Terina is 43 years old and married. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been doing this for 10 years and earns additional income from buying & selling vegetables. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. Terina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Merizol

texts.en:
As a married parent of 9 children, Merizol works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Merizol is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Merizol has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by selling biscuits in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Robina is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of biscuits to sell to her customers.

Robina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and send her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of two (boy and girl).  In order to help her husband to pay the household bills, Alima sells blankets and baby clothes at home.  She applied for this loan to buy a new winter clothing collection for kids.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Teresita works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and also earns additional income from renting a boarding house.

Teresita is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of expanding the business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chuff-cutter and construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is still selling green groceries in Mombasa, and he says that his business improved after the boost from the previous loan to add more stock. He informs us that his family is doing well and that he is happy with the ways things are.
 
He is currently requesting another loan after he repaid the previous one well. He plans to use this money to add more stock of greens and fruits for his grocery shop. 

He will use the anticipated profit to open a new business, which he was not able to do with the precious loan, and to build his own permanent home so that his family can have a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for more than twenty years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Marlita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and buckets and baskets for storage. With this, she will be able to improve her sales and profit.

In the future, Marlita hopes to make her business a success. In addition, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and buckets and baskets for storage

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a junk shop. Merlie is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her market stall for her fish vending business.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her market stall

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and married, with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosa has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 14000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy materials needed for her shell-crafting business.

Rosa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa, 40 años de edad, acompañada con tres hijos de 17, 21 y 23 todos mayores de edad, los cuales los tres trabajan, ella es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a  brindar el servicio de molino lo cual tiene más de siete  años que se dedica a esta honorable labor,  Cándida ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio desde hace más de un a querido realizar la mejoras dos cuartos pero no lo había realizado por falta de disponibilidad económica, El financiamiento que solicita es para la reparación y mejora de dos cuartos para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zin, alfajillas, puertas, cemento, piso, arena, entre otros, Su deseo es ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa, age 40, has three children, ages 17, 21, and 23.  They are grown, and the three of them work.

She is a very hard-working person who provides milling services.  She has been devoted to this honorable work for over seven years.  Cándida has been able to get her children ahead, and little by little her business has been improving.

For over a year she has wanted to make improvements to two rooms, but she has not done so for lack of available finances.  The loan she is requesting is to repair and improve two rooms.  It is to buy construction materials like zinc, rafters, doors, cement, flooring, and sand, among others.  Her wish is to keep improving her house.

loans.use: to finish two rooms.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 30-year-old shop retailer in Mombasa.  She is married and supports four people in her family.  She has been in business for the last five years and her business is doing well.

This is her second loan after the first loan was repaid successfully.  She will use the loan amount to purchase more items including milk, washing soap, maize flour, wheat flour, and beans.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan.  She is looking forward to growing her business to an international level.

loans.use: to purchase items for her retail store (milk, washing soap, maize flour, wheat flour, and beans).

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a farmer in Central Kenya, Nkubu area, where he lives with his family of two children, ages 17 and 13 years. He has been in farming for six years and sells his produce, which includes mainly maize and coffee, to the local market.

Joshua has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says this will help him boost and diversify his farming business as well as provide income to help educate his children. He plans to buy additional land to expand his farming business.
 
He says poor infrastructure, pests, and animal diseases are the main challenges to the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes for his farming business.

loans.name: Holman Jose

texts.es:
Holman, originario de San Lorenzo, de las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de  2 hijos de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la agricultura, su primer crédito fue de gran ayuda, ya que le permitió acudir muy bien sus cultivos, incrementando su producción. Su primer préstamo lo utilizo para comprar  insumo como frijoles y maíz, a la misma vez  pagar mano de obra de sus trabajadores y comprar más animales como  vaca. Cuando el no esta sembrando se dedica al negocio de pulpería.
El  desea hacer crecer  su negocio con productos de alta calidad es por eso que hoy en día solicita un segundo  préstamo  para invertir aun mas en su negocio de pulpería  en la compra de mercadería en general  como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, etc.  Con el objetivo de cubrir la demanda de los clientes, el estima que esta nueva inversión será de ayuda ya que podrá mantener su negocio activo, el espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para seguir  trabajando en su negocio, de esta manera poder obtener mas ingresos y asi ofrecerle un mejor nivel de vida económico a su familia.
texts.en:
Holman is originally from San Lorenzo, a community on the outskirts of Teustepe.  He is married, and is the father of two children.  He is a tradesman and makes a living in agriculture.  

His first loan was a great help to him, and it allowed his crops to grow well, increasing his production.  He used his first loan to buy supplies like beans and corn, while at the same time, also paying the workers and buying more animals, like cows.  When he is not planting, he makes a living in his grocery store.

He wishes to grow his business with higher-quality products.  It is because of this that he is requesting his second loan to invest more in his grocery store in the purchase of general merchandise, like rice, sugar, oil, soap, etc.  

With the objective of covering the demand of his customers, he estimates that this new investment will help him since he will be able to maintain his active business.  He hopes to count on the support of Kiva in order to continue working in his business.  In this way, he will be able to obtain more income and thereby offer a greater quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Las Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
Nelly es una integrante del grupo Las Carmelitas, ella platica que hace un poco mas de 15 años tiene en su hogar una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar la cual atiende ella personalmente y vende de todo un poco.

Nelly solo estudio la preparatoria y es soltera, un credito de VisionFund le dara la oportunidad de comprar, azucar, arroz,sopa, aceite, frijol, dulces, refrescos, papel higenico y variedad de productos enlatados para resultar su negocio.

Ella dice que el reto que enfrenta en tiempo muerto (cuando la zafra termina y los ingenios dejan de trabajar) porque la gente tiene menos dinero y se vende poco pero ella no se deanima ya que como todo negocio hay altas y bajas.

Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es tratar con la gente y han hecho buenos amigos.
sus ganancias las invertiran en la compra de mas insumos y en tener una mejor calidad de vida


los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Isabel-venta de antojitos
Flora-venta de antojitos
Genaro-servicio de taller mecanico
Dominga denta de antojitos
Ana-venta de antojitos
Natalia-Venta de calzado
Maria Guadalupe-Estetica
Maria Isabel-Venta de zapatos
Josefina-zapatos
Santa-Comida corrida
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Las Carmelitas communal bank.  She says that she has had her grocery store in her house for a little over 15 years.  She personally tends the store, and she sells a bit of everything.

Nelly only went to high school, and she is single.  A loan from VisionFund would give her the opportunity to buy sugar, rice, soup, cooking oil, beans, candy, soft drinks, toilet paper, and a variety of canned good to stock her business.

She says that the challenge she faces is during the dead time (when the harvest is over and the sugar refineries stop work).  This is because people have less money and little is sold.  However, this does not discourage her because, like all businesses, they are highs and lows.

The thing she likes the most about her business is dealing with the people, and she has made good friends.  She will invest her earnings in the purchase of more supplies and in having a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are:

Isabel-Sells snacks
Flora-Sells snacks
Genaro-Mechanic shop services
Dominga –Sells snacks
Ana-Sells snacks
Natalia-Sells shoes
Maria Guadalupe-Beauty parlor
Maria Isabel-Sells shoes
Josefina-Shoes
Santa-Fast food

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soup, cooking oil, beans, candy, soft drinks, toilet paper, and a variety of canned goods.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 49 years old and married. His children are between 10 and 27 years old.  He runs a retail shop that has been in operation for a period of eleven years, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES. 

He is now servicing his fourth term loan of 70,000 KES from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase more stock to sell in the retail shop, e.g. sugar, maize flour, and packets of sweets. 

The profit he gets will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for his school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in the retail shop, e.g. sugar, maize flour, and packets of sweets

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man, 28 years old, married, and a father of two children. He is a tailor and has been in this business for four years. He gets a monthly income of KES 25,000 (Kenyan shillings).

This will be Paul's seventh loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making new clothes. In the future, he wants to start a tailoring school.

loans.use: to buy material for making clothes.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 39 years old and married with four children.

Rachel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Rachel has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rachel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, who is 24 years old, is very hard working and responsible. He owns a motorbike and has been in business for the last five years. He describes his business as very busy. He also earns an income by farming. 

Faulu Kenya has helped him learn how to save his money. Someday Robert hopes to have a herd of cattle. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy spare parts for his motorbike and a dairy cow.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorbike and a dairy cow

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Rowena requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is a 60-year-old butcher in Mtwapa Mombasa. She is a single mother who supports four in her family. She has been in this business for the last 22 years and she is doing great. 

Edwina is requesting her second loan to purchase cattle for slaughter in her butchery after repaying the first loan successfully. She will use the anticipated profit to uplift her green grocer business and hopes to see her businesses grow and expand to other branches in Mombasa county.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for slaughter in her butchery

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Being a widowed, supporting a daughter and two sons is hard, but Fatmeh is trying her best to afford the best she can for her kids. 

Fatmeh used the previous loan to hang more shelves and bring a few more snacks to her kiosk. She has now applied for another loan to bring to her kiosk more basic food products like rice, sugar, and even food cans, to make some profit.

loans.use: to bring to her kiosk more basic food products.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 42 years old, married and has three children. She runs a mobile phone money transaction business. She has been in business for one year. She also relies on her husband’s salary. 

Priscilla used to previously sell secondhand clothes. She is very focused and hard-working. Faulu Kenya has helped her learn how to save her money for future purposes. She hopes to open a supermarket. 

Priscilla requires a loan of 32,298.75 KES to add float (prepaid credits) for mobile transactions.

loans.use: to add float for mobile transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
The previous loan has helped Amal improve her small snacks store at home, as she bought a fridge and added selling drinks and ice cream. She also started selling clothes for special occasions to benefit from the high demand of clothing items in those seasons. 

Now Amal has applied for another loan to improve the store she has and bring some basic food products like rice, sugar, etc. in larger quantities and sell them by the kilo to other housewives in the neighborhood.

loans.use: purchase some basic food products like rice and sugar

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: This time, for her ninth loan cycle, Jessica is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy ingredients for her food production business. The general store business that she previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), Kiva's field partner, continues and provides Jessica and her family with increased income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 46-year-old widow. After her husband's death, she has been supporting and looking after her two daughters and one son. 

Wafaa is known for her artistic sense. She makes wall-hanging crafts using sackcloth and hay. She also draws on glass and pottery, as shown in the photo. 

Now, Wafaa has applied for a loan to buy more raw materials, to make more crafts and be able to participate in bazaars to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for craft-making.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is from the suburban area of Kisauni. He is 26 years old and single, with many goals to achieve. 

Hussein is engaged in the transportation business, using his motorcycle. He has been engaged in this business for many years. In addition, he recently started a firewood selling business. 

Hussein is requesting a loan of Ksh 10,000 to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 52 years old and married with five children.

Primitiva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling wood in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of wood to sell.

Primitiva has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling wood business for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Primitiva aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of wood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

Rosalina has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a variety store.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to venture into poultry farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old, married, and supports a family of five. Her children are between 24 and 12 years old. She owns a private school in the Chemelil location which has been in operation for a period of 14 years, earning her an income of KES 71,000.

Elizabeth is servicing a first term loan of KES 30,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) which she intends to use to purchase construction materials for a new classroom. The profits she earns will be used to reinvest and build more classrooms. She hopes to expand her school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a new classroom.

loans.name: Sithan's Group

texts.en:
Sithan is from a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and she is a single woman. Sithan has been involved in farming rice, raising pigs, and weaving mats. Engaging in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 6,000 each day, after daily expenses. Rice paddy being destroyed by insects is the main challenge to her paddy. 

Sithan is in her first microloan with VisionFund Cambodia. Now, she is leading her group to request a loan of KHR 160,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. Sithan hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to improve a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Toun's Group

texts.en:
Toun, 44, lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been farming rice, weaving mats and fishing for 20 years. Toun and her husband can earn about 19,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Toun is now requesting her second microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund as part of a group of three who all live in the same village. Each member is requesting KHR 160,000, and Toun will use her loan to buy materials for building a proper latrine. She thereby hopes to have a hygienic latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Sron's Group

texts.en:
Sron, 63 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sa Ang district, Kandal province. He is married and has five children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. 

Sron and his wife have been engaged in farming rice and planting vegetables for 33 years. His family’s daily income is about KHR 24,000 per day, but they can manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day, after deducting daily expenses. 

Sron has just joined with VisionFund Cambodia this cycle. Now, he is leading his group of three to request a loan of KHR 160,000 each. 

As the leader, Sron will use his portion to buy materials, such as a latrine bowl, tile, and sewage draining, to build a proper latrine. He hopes this loan will enable his family to have a proper latrine for an improved life.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and to expand dairy housing unit

loans.name: Farhodi

texts.ru: Фарходи житель района Бохтар. Ему 22 года. Фарходи недавно женился. Он живет с родителями. Фарходи намерен взять в аренду магазин на рынке. Также он намерен закупит необходимых товар. Фарходи хочет начать свой бизнес. Он берет кредит для приобретения одежды и аренды магазина, чтобы заняться торговлей женской, мужской и детской одежды.
texts.en:
Farhodi is a resident of the Bohtar region. He is 22 years old. Farhodi married not long ago. He lives with his parents. 

Farhodi intends to rent a store at the market. Further he intends to purchase necessary goods. Farhodi would like to start his own business. He takes a loan for the purchase of clothing and for the store rent, in order to work with selling women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase women's, men's and children's clothing and rent a store

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 34 года. Она не замужем. Зухро портниха. Она работает в ателье. Зухро делает свою работу профессионально. В этой области она имеет богатый опыт. Зухро берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки, чтобы у себя дома также заняться шитьем.
texts.en:
Zuhro lives in the Rudaki region.  She is 34 years old and not married.  She is a seamstress and works in a dress-maker's shop.  Zuhro does her work expertly.  She has a great deal of experience in this field.  

Zuhro is taking out this loan to buy a sewing machine so she will be able to work for herself at home as well.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчон живет в Яванском районе. Ему 31 год. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Комилчон со своей семьей занимается земледелием. Он хочет закупить семян пшеницы для посева.
texts.en: Komiljon lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He is 31 years old, married, and has 5 children. Komiljon and his family are farmers. He would like to purchase wheat seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Pork's Group

texts.en: Pork is 59 years old and lives in a rural area of the Sa Ang district. She has three children, all of whom depend on her and help out with their family's businesses. She is a rice farmer while her husband works in construction. They have both been in their current lines of work for 30 years and earn about KHR 23,000 per day. This allows her to save about KHR 10,000 a day after paying her daily expenses. Pork’s loan group is made up of two members who have taken out one previous loan from VisionFund. This previous loan helped Pork improve her family's living conditions. Now the two members of this group are asking for a loan for 160,000 KHR each. Pork is going to going to use her portion of this loan to build a latrine because this will allow her family to have a healthier and cleaner life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mwanamjaka

texts.en:
Mwanamjaka, a young woman with an entrepreneurial and business-minded spirit, lives with her partner who works with the municipal council. They have two children who are in school, one in form two and the youngest in class six.

Five years ago, Mwanamjaka was inspired to succeed in retail through charcoal sales. She dedicates herself to this activity 10 hours a day, and in this way offers personalized service. She has applied to Yehu for a loan to help increase her stock of charcoal, which will serve to advance her dream of establishing a small business and, above all, investing in the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old and has ten solid years of experience in the farming business, with vegetables and milk being his main farm produce for the local market. He is married with two children, one of whom is still schooling.

Patrick has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy poultry birds for a venture into the poultry business. He says this will improve his farming income, hence the family's living standards. He plans to expand his dairy farming with the poultry income since he hopes the poultry business will yield more returns, faster.

Patrick notes drought and animal diseases as the main challenges, but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for staffing for farmer's training.

loans.use: to venture into the poultry business.

loans.name: Barbine

texts.fr: Madame Barbine est une femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capital. Elle détien un comptoir dans un marché de la place où elle vend: Le gombo, les pattates et quelques légumes. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa competence dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt d'un montant de 50000 pour acheter des vivres en gro, entre autres la tomate, les légumes et bien d'autres. Les bénéfices tirés de ce crédit lui permettront de fluxtifier son capital, améliorer son cadre de vie et enfin de subvenir aux differents besoins des membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Barbine is a woman who lives in a district of the capital. She runs a stall in a market place where she sells: okra, potatoes, and some other vegetables. Thanks to her energetic personality and her competence as a merchant, she has a growing clientele whose increasing demand is becoming hard to satisfy.

For this reason, Barbine is requesting a loan of 50,000 XAF to purchase food at wholesale. She plans to buy tomatoes, as well as vegetables, among other things. The income Barbine earns due to this loan will allow her to have more flexible capital, to improve her quality of life, and to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs at wholesale (tomatoes, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is requesting a new loan to increase the amount of working capital she has for her business. She will use this loan to buy more clothing and a wider variety of items to sell to her customers. She is very grateful for the support she has received from Yehu and Kiva. Agnes is a responsible person who has very many goals to achieve. She believes that through her hard work, she will achieve success.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La Sra. Anita tiene 35 años, se considera una persona muy carismática, honesta, sencilla y que le gusta trabajar mucho. Anita vive con sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra que se encuentra en la Provincia de Imbabura, Anita como una forma de salir adelante y buscar un bienestar para su familia emprendió el  trabajo de realizar y vender tamales y humitas, productos comestibles a base de maíz y de harina. Anita trabaja en este negocio por tres años por iniciativa propia, le va muy bien gracias a su carisma y buenos productos, las ganancias que obtiene de este negocio utilizan en los gastos de su hogar y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
 Actualmente Anita solicitó un crédito a FODEMI con el cual invertirá en la compra de una cocina industrial, una tamalera y en insumos como maíz tierno y harina para la realización de tamales y humitas para la venta, ya que la demanda de sus productos es cada día mayor.
Anita sueña en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos dándoles buenos estudios, también sueña en tener su propia casa. Es por ello que Anita sigue trabajando día a día para lograr cumplir su sueño y agradece a DIOS por darle la fuerza y la motivación para salir a delante.
texts.en:
Anita is 35, charismatic, honest, modest, and loves to work. Anita lives with her two children in the city of Ibarra in Imbabura province. To support her family and improve its circumstances, Anita began selling tamales and humitas, food items made with corn and flour. She has run this business by herself for three years, and it is prospering because of her good nature and good food. She uses the income from the business to pay household expenses and buy the things her children need.

Anita has applied to FODEMI for a loan to buy a commercial stove, a tamale machine, and supplies such as sweet corn to make tamales and humitas to meet ever-rising demand. She dreams of a better life for her children, including a good education, and of having her own house. She works hard each day to achieve her dreams and thanks God for giving her the strength and motivation to go on.

loans.use: to buy a commercial stove, a tamale machine, and supplies to make tamales and humitas to sell and deliver to houses in the city.

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 66 años de edad y es originario de una comunidad indígena Mazahua-Otomí, el es parte del grupo llamado El Calvario. Platica que desde hace 3 años el se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos y que tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa donde vende artículos básicos y que su esposa es quien le ayuda a atender el pequeño negocio. Dice que decidió emprender sus negocios para estar más al pendiente de su casa y que ya no se puede rentar como peón en las cosechas por su edad ya que le han surgido varios achaques (inconvenientes) como él dice. Plática que tiene varios borregos los cuales sale a vender cada jueves en un tianguis ganadero que se encuentra como a media hora de su casa y que ahí los vende a mejor precio. Ahorita el está pidiendo a Vision Fund un crédito para comprar alimento para sus animales y para venderlos a un mejor precio y también comprar vitaminas y desparacitantes. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Ruperta, Olivia y Gustavo ellos también están pidiendo sus créditos para la compra de alimento para sus borregos y ganado.
texts.en:
Miguel, 66, is a native of the indigenous community of Mazahua-Otomí.  He is a member of the communal bank "El Calvario."  He says that for 3 years he has been raising and selling sheep, and he also has a small grocery store in his house where he sells basic consumer products.  His wife helps him to tend to the small business.  He says that he decided to start up these businesses so that he could stay closer to his home, and because he could not get work as a day-laborer on farms due to his age and some ailments that he suffers from.  

Miguel says that he has a number of sheep that he goes to sell every Thursday in a livestock market that is located about a half an hour from his house.  At this market, he can sell at a good price.  At this time, he is requesting a loan from Vision Fund to buy feed, vitamins, and de-worming medicines for his animals so that he will be able to sell them at the best price. 

The other three member of this group are Ruperta, Olivia and Gustavo.  They are also requesting loans to buy feed for their sheep and other livestock.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, de-worming medicines and feed for his sheep

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Sa Ang district, Sary is 33 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Sary has been farming rice and planting vegetables on three hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for over than ten years, she is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for her plantation business. 

Sary has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle, while the other members are just with VisionFund this cycle. The past loan has helped Sary to better support her family as well as her children’s education. 

Sary is now leading her group of four to request her microloan from Kiva partner VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy materials for building a decent latrine, such as a latrine bowl, tile draining, sewage, etc. Sary hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mwanahatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu, 28, is a resident of Kisauni. She is happily married. She and her husband live with their two children, one of whom is already enrolled in school.  

Mwanatibu has owned a food stall for five years. She is satisfied with the results attained so far and always seeks to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Yehu to purchase ingredients like flour, raw potatoes, oils, etc. She notes that this will allow her to serve a wider range of people and increase her revenues.

In the future, Mwanatibu plans to take more Kiva loans to expand her business and hopefully boost her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, raw potatoes, oils, etc.

loans.name: Twibuke Group

texts.fr:
Sophie fait partie du groupe Twibuke et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a  37 ans et est mariée à Luc, un commerçant . Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants, âgés de 2  à 16 ans, dont 6 étudient.
Elle prend  soins  des 3 orphelins et 6 enfants membres de sa famille élargie, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de pagnes depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pagnes à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Sophie is part of the Twibuke Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 37 years old and is married to a merchant named Luc. Together they have seven children, aged two to 16 years, six of whom currently attend school. Sophie also takes care of three orphaned children and six members of her extended family, two of whom attend school.

Sophie has been a merchant of pagnes (traditional West African printed cloth) for the past ten years. She is on her ninth loan cycle with Turame. With the loan she receives from KIVA, Sophie plans to increase her capital and purchase a large number of pagnes which she will sell to earn more income. In the coming years, Sophie would like to buy a plot of land and build a house there.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large number of pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 36 years old, divorced and the father of one child. He also supports his mother, and earns his income by farming vegetables, fishing and raising pigs in the Kangemi section of Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and earns a monthly income of 18,000 shillings. He is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD. and plans to use it to expand one of his businesses by buying more piglets. One of his goals for the future is to have a large number of fish ponds.

loans.use: to buy ten piglets.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 35 years old and married with six children, five of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, earning a living through farming rice and planting taros while her husband catches fish to help earn income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 4,000 each day for their future needs. 

Srey is just joining with VisionFund Cambodia this cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle. Now, Srey is leading her group of two to request a loan of KHR 160,000 each. 

As the leader, Srey will use her portion to buy materials such as a latrine bowl and sewage and tile draining, for construction of a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family have a proper latrine for use.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a proper latrine.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a 32-year-old single mother of two children aged 11 and 3 years, has been operating a dairy farming business for 12 years now. She earns a monthly income of 50,000 shillings.

Gladys has requested her second loan with KADET LTD in order to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to use the profits to improve her farming business as she strives to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en: Dimitri is 25 years old. He lives with his wife, parents, brother and grandmother in a small village in Khashuri district. His grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese in an open market at a good price locally. Besides, Dimitri owns 2.5 hectares of agricultural land, where potatoes, tomatoes, maize, haricot and onions are grown. He sells the harvested products locally at a good price. Dimitri is a very hard working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to purchase four calves. After purchasing additional calves, he will be able to expand his cattle. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Dimitri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is a farmer from Gyumri town. He grows potatoes and breeds cattle. His livestock currently includes 9 mother and 32 little pigs. Ara lives with his wife and two children. 

He has applied for this loan to expand his agricultural business. With the requested amount Ara will purchase potato and barley seeds. He is a very hardworking person and he will do his best in order to get a good harvest and have high income. This will enable him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for potato and barley seeds

loans.name: Angelica  Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Angélica pudo estudiar la carera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para engreírlos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angélica trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y los buenos precios que brinda a sus clientes.
Angélica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la tramitación para obtener su título profesional, adicionalmente podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para desarrollarse profesionalmente y en poco tiempo desea lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Angélica is 37 and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and wants to succeed. Thanks to her efforts and her parents' support, she was able to study business administration. She likes to spend her free time with her family and occasionally cook a delicious cerviche to pamper them. On her own initiative and with dedication and perseverance, Angélica sells clothing every day for about 10 hours from early morning. She likes her business and believes it is prospering because she treats her customers well and offers affordable prices.

Angélica thanks the Kiva lenders whose help will make it possible for her to pay her diploma fees. She will also be able to buy more clothing to stock her business and to keep working and growing professionally. She hopes to shortly achieve her dream to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay her diploma fees.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single lady of 42 years old. She is a widow and has one child. 

Jane makes liquid soap and detergent, and she also sells potatoes. She has been in this business for sixteen years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 70,000.

This will be Jane's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy ingredients for making soap and detergents. 

In the future, Jane wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making soap.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a mother of four children, the youngest of which still attends school. She lives with her family in a rural area of Central Kenya where she has been practicing farming for 20 years. She grows bananas, maize, vegetables and tea, all of which she sells in a local market. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help buy supplies for her farm, especially pesticides which will help her grow more vegetables and bananas. Her main challenges are insects and thieves who steal parts of her crop. She applauds Juhudi Kilimo for helping farmers maximize their production.

loans.use: to buy insecticide.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old. She is a single mother with two children. She does dairy farming and has been in this business for eight years. She earns a monthly income of 22,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase feed for animals.She plans to use the profits to purchase more cows.

In the future she wants to become a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 26 years old, married to John and a mother of two children. She runs a typing business, while also doing dairy farming. She has been in business for two years now and earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will Jane's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy reams of paper in bulk. In the future, she wants to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: To buy printing papers in bulk

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 36 años  de edad, casado con dos hijos, menores de edad, de 12,4 años. Él es originario de la Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro de caracteriza por su comida típica de la región  como “quesillo y tiste”   Wilfredo tiene por actividad económica taller de soldadura, el cual consisten en brindar servicios a sus clientes de su comunidad y vecinos aledaños. El negocio surgió por la  necesidad de tener una fuente  de trabajo para sacar a su familia adelante y brindarle estabilidad económica. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de herramientas  de trabajo como: un soldador, llaves, desarmadores, alicate, tenazas. Wilfredo tiene una rutina de trabajo de unas 10 horas diario prestando el servicio en su casa de habitación y presta servicios a domicilio. Wilfredo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener una fuente de trabajo digna.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 36, is married and has 2 children aged 12 and 4.  He is a native of La Paz Centro, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  La Paz Centro is known for its traditional cuisine, including "quesillo" (a thick corn tortilla wrapped around soft cheese, pickled onions and sauce) and "tiste" (a chocolately corn drink).  

Wilfred has a soldering workshop where he provides services to customers from his community and from surrounding areas.  He started this business because he needed to have a source of work so that he could provide for his family and give them economic stability. With this loan, he will buy some tools for his work, including: a welder, wrenches, screwdrivers, pliers, and tongs.  Wilfredo has a work routine where he works for 10 hours a day from his house, and also provides services at his customer's homes.  Wilfredo appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a source of decent work.

loans.use: to buy a welder, wrenches, screwdrivers, pliers, and tongs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Having successfully repaid her loan, Pauline has decided to expand her businesses. She says they are doing very well. 

However, she narrates that her working capital is still needy. Since the previous loan, her businesses have been growing little by little. She is currently asking for a new loan to buy a stock of firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy a stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 29 years old and has been in active farming for five years in her rural home in Central Kenya. Her farm produces tea, bananas, maize and cabbage. She also runs a tailoring business for additional income. She is single with one child who is four years old.

Zipporah has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy piglets for a venture into pig farming. She hopes to gain more income and establish a big pork butchery within the local market. She believes she will be able to improve her family's living standard and educate her child.

Zipporah notes the main challenge is the inadequacy of funds for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is an active woman who is enterprising, dedicated to her work, and a fighter with many goals that she wants to achieve. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and is very happy with her businesses.

Mkambe wants to expand her charcoal-selling business by having enough stock. She plans to purchase sacks of charcoal since demand has increased, and she does not want to disappoint her customers.

Since her last loan, her income has been increasing gradually with adequate provision to her family.

Mkambe has good payment references and is responsible. She promises to settle the debt and at the same time has hope that she will bring home financial security and a better quality of life for everyone.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Hannah from Moriba town Bo, Southern area. She is married with two children, 6 years and 10 years old. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2006, Hannah established her retail business. Her husband is a teacher, but his income is not enough to take care of the home. Hannah began her business because she wants to create income to support the family. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. She says her business is doing well because her business is the only retail business within the community.

Hannah requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, and cigarettes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Hannah plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, and cigarettes for her store.

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en:
Brigid is 30 years old and single and supports three children. She still runs her retail Agrovet (medicines and care products for animals) shop in Kapsabet. Now it is four years in operation, and her monthly income has increased to KES 25,000.  

Brigid is servicing her second term loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to purchase additional stock for her Agrovet business.  

The profits she earns will be used to pay the loan and plough into the business. Brigid hopes for prosperity in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her Agrovet business.

loans.name: Malla

texts.fr: Madame Malla est une jeune dame agée de 30 ans qui vit dans un quartier de la capital. Elle detien un comptoir dans un marché de la place où elle vend: Les oignons, la cola, quelques fruits, l'okok etc. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa compétences dans ce domaine, elle s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit d'un montant de 150000 pour acheter la marchandise (l'okok, la cola, quelques condiments, les oignons etc). Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettra de fluxtifier son capital, augmenter son stock de marchandise et enfin subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Malla is a young woman who is 30 years old and who lives in an area of the capital. She has a stand in the local market where she sells her goods: onions, kola nuts, fruits, okok (a leafy vegetable), etc. Due to her dynamism and competence in this area, she has developed a growing clientele that she would like to continue to satisfy. She is asking for a loan for 150,000 FCFA in order to buy goods (okok, kola nuts, condiments, onions, etc.). The profits she earns from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and inventory, and ultimately support her family.

loans.use: to buy goods like okok (a leafy vegetable), onions, kola nuts, etc.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Marian from Moriba town Bo, Southern area. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 15. Her children are currently attending school. She began a clothing business to have a permanent source of income.

Marian runs her business within a busy market area, selling wax cotton, lace and traditional pattern design cotton .She has been in business for 10 years. She works 10 hours per day and seven days per week. Her business is the only income she has and she says it is doing well.

Marian has requested a loan to buy more clothing material like wax cotton, lace and traditional pattern design cotton for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to import clothing material. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material like wax cotton, lace and traditional pattern design cotton for resale.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 44-year-old Agness from Kulanda town, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 18. Two of her children currently attend school. 

Agness runs a food stand business within her community, selling vegetable oil, tomato paste and flour. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business every day from morning to night. Her children usually help her run the business. At present, she is faced with insufficient capital to run her business.   

Agness has requested a loan to buy more vegetable oil, tomato paste and flour for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to own a shop to sustain her family. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more vegetable oil, tomato paste and flour for resale.

loans.name: Celia Zunilda

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es padre y madre para él, gracias a su esfuerzo Celia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, lamentablemente no ha podido encontrar trabaja en este rubro, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos potajes y en algunas ocasiones prepara una riquísima Carapulcra, la cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Celia trabaja en su pequeña tienda de regalos, ella vende diversos productos, en especial peluches, Celia trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y facilidades de pago que brinda a sus clientes.
Celia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual servirá de mucho para que su hijo pueda desarrollar sus labores académicas y mejorar sus métodos de estudio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Celia is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her son, whom she loves. He is her main reason for living. Celia is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to getting her son ahead; she is both mother and father to him. Thanks to her hard work Celia was able to study education, but, unfortunately, she was unable to find work in this area. In her free time she enjoys cooking delicious concoctions. Sometimes she makes the delicious carapulcra, her favourite food. On her own initiative, with hard work and dedication, Celia works in her small gift shop. She sells various products, especially stuffed animals. She works every day from the wee hours of the morning and is able to work approximately 12 hours. She thinks that things are going well for her because of her good prices and easy payment options. Celia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to this help she will be able to buy a computer. This will be a great help for her son's academic work and it will improve his study methods. She will keep working hard in order to achieve her great dream of expanding her business and owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic stock such as rice, sugar, corn, beans, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Hawanatu is 35 years old and married with four children, ranging in age from  5 to 14. She runs a mini-provision shop at Kulanda town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. Her four children are currently attending school.

She's been in this business for five years, selling Ovaltine, milk, sugar and mayonnaise. Her husband is also a businessman but his income is not enough to take care of the children. Sometimes, the goods she sells expire due to slow purchasing power of customers.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more provision items like Ovaltine, milk, sugar and mayonnaise for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the life of her family. In the future, she would like to have a big business structure of her own. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provision items like Ovaltine, milk, sugar and mayonnaise for resale

loans.name: Egor

texts.en: Egor is from the Akhalkalaki district. He is 24 years old, married and lives with his parents, grandparents, wife and infant child.  Egor’s income source is the small amount he earns from his grocery store. Besides, his grandparents are provided with a retirement pension. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Egor decided to start a new business. In particular, he plans to finish the renovation of a store and rent it out for a good price. Egor has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. However, his loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, for they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Egor will install doors and windows in his newly built store and renovate it properly so that it satisfies the personal needs of his clients. A private company has already expressed an interest in renting it. Egor hopes his business will be profitable and this will increase his income, providing his family with enough money to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the store for renting out.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 26 years old. He lives in Tbilisi with his mother. 

The family has their income from a newly-started business in their local town. Aleksandre has a fast food café. He sells the produced food from the café, as well as taking private orders. 

The café is a profitable project, but it needs support for further development. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Aleksandre will purchase a refrigerator and gas cooker that will be used for cooking meals. According to his estimations, his project will be profitable, and he will attract many customers. As a result of the new business initiative, the income of the family will increase and their living conditions will improve. 

In addition to the above mentioned, in case of need in the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and gas cooker for the fast food café.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
Ulises es un hombre de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Ulises no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cantar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tallarín Saltado, el cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ulises trabaja como chofer de motocarga, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ulises se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mantenimiento genera de su motocarga, de esta manera Ulises tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ulises is 24, single, and lives in the city of Ica. He is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and wants to succeed. He began working at a young age because of scarce resources and couldn't pursue systems engineering as he had hoped. He likes to sing in his free time and make his favorite dish, delicious chicken with noodles. On his own initiative and with dedication, Ulises drives a motor transport bike. He works every day from early morning for about eight hours. He likes his job and feels it is going well because he treats his customers nicely.

Ulises thanks the Kiva lenders whose support will help him buy replacement parts and do maintenance on his motorbike so that he can keep his professional equipment in the best condition. This way he can keep working hard to get ahead and achieve his dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and do maintenance on his motorbike.

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr: Monsieur Eric est un homme agé de 34 ans, qui vit dans un quartier de la capital. Il detient une laverie dans un coin de la place depuis plus de 1 an. Grâce à son dynamisme et et sa competence dans ce domaine, il s'est faite une clientèle grandissante qu'il aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela il sollicite un prêt d'un montant de 200000 pour s'acquerir d'une seconde machine de nettoyage de véhicules à pressing (Catcheur). Les bénéfices tirés de prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses recettes, fideliser sa clientèle, mieux amenager le site et enfin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eric is a 34-year-old man who lives in a district of the capital. He has been running a vehicle washing service in a corner of his space for more than a year. Thanks to his energetic personality and competence in his field, Eric has an ever-growing clientele whose demand he would like to continue to meet.

For this reason, Eric is seeking a loan of 200,000 XAF to purchase a second machine for cleaning vehicles. The income he earns from this loan will help him to increase his revenue and his customer loyalty. It will also allow him to better prepare his work site and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a second machine for cleaning vehicles.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who is pictured next to his taxi, is a 31-year-old single young man.

For the past three years, Mohammad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family.

Mohammad is requesting a 2,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him complete the price of purchasing the taxi and to cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. Having his own taxi will enable Mohammad to take additional internal and external requests and work extra hours. This will improve his income and ensure him a better future.

loans.use: To complete the price of the taxi and to pay the cost of insuring and licensing the taxi

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 25-year-old Kenyan woman. She lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She is friendly and, above all, a hard-working woman. She started her tailoring business many years ago. She’s very talented at her job, especially after more than five years of experience in the same occupation. People in her town and in the surrounding areas are sure that she can offer them high quality designs at fair prices.

At times, she delivers finished garments to her customers in their homes door to door.

To provide the family with extra financial support, her husband also works and has his own business. With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Yehu, Mary will purchase new textile designs and different types of needles and thread among many other items. She seeks to open her own tailoring training unit in the future, hoping to enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase new textile designs and different types of needles and thread along with many other items.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en:
Ghadeer is a 30-year-old, married woman. Her husband works two jobs, one as a taxi driver and the other as a driver for a cargo company. They have a boy and a girl to raise. Ghadeer also takes part in the family finances; she has a small home business making straw baskets and trays. 

Ghadeer has applied for a youth loan to buy more raw materials to start making mirror frames and other straw crafts.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her craft-making business.

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en:
Rasmiya is a 55-year-old, married woman, raising her three sons and a daughter with the help of her husband. As participation in adding another source of income to the family, Rasmiya works to sell detergents. She buys detergents in gallons from the factories or other distributors and resells it in smaller quantities to individuals. 

Rasmiya has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of detergent she has and to buy new types of detergents, like shampoo and others.

loans.use: to buy detergents for resale.

loans.name: Chibaty Group

texts.es: Margarita tiene 44 años de edad ella es originaria de una comunidad muy pintoresca y donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanía en ocoshal. Platica que a ella la invito una amiga a sacar un crédito para mejorar sus árboles de aguacate ya que su amiga los vio y le dijo “Mago esos aguacates están en muy mal estado necesitas echarle abono para que tengas buena cosechas", a la cual ella respondió "la verdad es que ahorita no tengo mucho capital para invertirle y todo está muy caro para mantenerlo en mejores condiciones", fue entonces que su amiga la invito a formar parte de su grupo llamado Chibaty donde le hacían un crédito para mejorar sus negocios es por eso que ella decidió entrar porque quiere mejorar sus árboles para poder obtener mejores ganancias y así ayudar a su esposo a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Dice que tiene 58 árboles que ya tienen 4 años y que no han dado mucho fruto porque no ha podido darles un mantenimiento óptimo pero que cuando es tiempo de cosecha ella sale a la central de abastos de una población cercana y ahí los vende por bolsitas ya que no es mucha la cosecha que saca. Dice que ella espera que con este crédito poder comprar lo necesario para sus árboles como fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, insecticidas, calidra para que estén en mejores condiciones, dice que esta agradecida con Visión Fund porque le hará el crédito ya que le servirá de mucho y lo aprovechara muy bien. Las otras cinco integrantes del grupo se llaman María Leucadia, Amelia, Irma, María Crisanta, Ausencia ella invertirán en insumos para el cultivo de aguacate y para comprar material para hacer artesanías en ocoshal.
texts.en: Margarita is 44 and is from a very picturesque community where the majority of the residents make Ocoshal [woven pine fiber] handcrafts. Margarita tells us that a friend invited her to take out a loan in order to improve her avocado trees; this friend saw her trees and said "These trees are in very bad shape; you need to fertilize them in order to have a good harvest". Margarita replied "The truth is that right now I don't have much capital to invest, and everything I would need to keep them in better shape is very expensive". It was then that her friend invited her to form part of her group, called Chibaty, where they were taking out a loan to improve their businesses. Margarita decided to join because she wanted to improve her trees and thus help her husband to improve their living conditions. She says that she has 58 trees that are already 4 years old, and that they have not yielded much fruit because she has not been able to provide optimal maintenance. When it is harvest time, she goes to the central supply centre of a nearby village and sells her fruit in small bags; her harvest is not very large. She says that she hopes that, with this loan, she will be able to buy everything her trees need, such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and Calidra-brand lime. She says that she is grateful to Vision Fund because they will provide this loan. It will be of great use to her and she will benefit greatly. The other five group members are called María Leucadia, Amelia, Irma, María Crisanta, and Ausencia. They will invest in supplies for the cultivation of avocado and for the purchase of materials for making Ocoshal [woven pine fiber] handcrafts.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, insecticides, fertilizers, and Calidra-brand lime.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 38-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, who is a farmer, are supporting a family of eight members. Hiyam sells clothes and cosmetic products at home. She is almost running out of clothes, so she applied for a loan to buy a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.use: to buy new collection of winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old. She is married. She has three children. She operates a dairy farm, and she has been in this business for ten years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty-nine thousand shillings.

This is Mercy's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase a dairy cow, and she plans to use the profits to expand her business. In the future, she wants to become a wealthy farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a thirty-six-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for thirteen years. His passion to nurture young people is what drove him into service, and he says he is inspired each day that he sees his students succeed. His low salary limits his ability to meet his family's basic needs. His dreams are to educate his children up to a university level and also upgrade his studies, as his goal is to become a school principal. Enock intends to use the loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre muy responsable Doña Yolanda platica que siempre ha vivido en la comunidad ella tiene 48 años de edad estudio la secundario se caso con el señor Juan quien trabaja como mecánico ellos están casados desde hace 22 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando.
Doña Yolanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 2 años y medio la inicio porque entre pláticas con su esposo decidieron poner la tienda dice que siempre había sido unos de sus sueños tener un negocio propio donde ella pudiera administrar sola su tiempo. Esta vez solicito a la institución un crédito para poder abastecer su tienda gracias al préstamo pudo mejorar su tienda comprando detergentes, refrescos, leche, huevo, pan, sabritas etc. La señora Yolanda comento "Recuerdo cuando inicie la tienda solo teníamos un anaquel donde poníamos productos perecederos que no se echaran a perder fácilmente y con el tiempo pude comprar otro mostrador más grande y poco a poco he ido comprado mas cosas, gracias al crédito que la institución me otorga por ejemplo hace poco pude obtener un exhibidor mas grande refrescos ya que el anterior es demasiado chico y no podía tener tantos refrescos" Doña Yolanda comenta que el reto mas grande es la competencia que tiene a sus alrededores pero siempre trata de dar el mejor servicio tener todo lo que sus clientas le llegan a pedir, platica que un dia una niña le llego a comprar un pastilla pero no la tenia en su tienda le pidió que  a la niña que le permitiera un momento entonces lo que hizo Doña Yolanda consiguió la pastilla en otra tienda aunque a un precio mas caro pero todo lo hizo por no quedar mal con su clienta la niña.
Ahora su meta es hacer mas grande su tienda considera que tiene ya todo lo de abarrotes solo que ahora ya quiere meter frutas y verduras para que sus ganancias puedan aumentar y asi poder ayudar a sus hijos con su educación.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 48, is a very hardworking and always very responsible woman.  Yolanda says that she has always lived in the community.  She studied in secondary school.  She married Juan, who works as a mechanic.  They have been married for 22 years and together they formed a family with three children, two of whom are students.

Yolanda has had a grocery store for two-and-a-half years.  She started it because she and her husband talked about setting up the store and decided to do it.  She says it had always been one of her dreams to have her own store that she could run on her own.

She asked the institution for this loan to be able to stock her store.  Thanks to the loan she was able to buy detergent, soft drinks, milk, eggs, bread, snacks, etc.

Yolanda commented: "I remember when I started the store we only had one shelf where we would put the perishables so they wouldn't spoil easily.  In time I managed to buy another counter that was bigger, and little by little I've been buying more things.  Thanks to the loan from the institution, for example, not long ago I got a bigger soft-drink case because the previous one is too small and I wasn't able to have as many soft drinks."

Yolanda comments that her biggest challenge is the competition around her, but she always tries to give the best service and have everything her customers request.  She says that one day a girl arrived to buy a pill that she didn't have, so she asked the girl to wait a moment and Yolanda got the pill from another store; it was more expensive, but she did it so she wouldn't look bad to her customer.

Now her goal is to expand her store.  She thinks she already has all the groceries, and now she wants to add fruits and vegetables to increase her profits so she can help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy detergent, toilet paper, oil, etc.

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, El Oro

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
In 2009, these 10 hard-working tribal women came together to help one another and form “Sarah Group”. They are all happily married and live in a small village at the outskirts of Senapati District in the State of Manipur located in the North Eastern part of India. 

Hoineikim is the profile member pictured with raised hand. She is 28 years old and is a mother to a son and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer by profession and often collects stones from the river to sell and earn income for the family. In order to supplement the family income, she joined the group to access loans.

With her first loan she initiated a small store. In her store she sells sugar, milk-powder, 'paan', cigarettes, chewing tobacco and eatables. She managed to repay her loan from the profit and from time to time add to her husband's scanty income. With the second loan, she increased her store's stock and expanded her store with newer varieties to sell. She made progress because her income in terms of profit is doublefold. She was in a position to support her two older children's education and managed the family expenditures all from her business. She also started saving INR 500 on a monthly basis. The saving is done with a group of 30 members. Every month one member gets the collected amount and it continues till every member gets the collected amount. This is one of the trends that poor people here use to somehow try to meet their capital needs.

Hoineikim together with her husband wishes to buy one buffalo for his farming activities and reduce ploughing expenses and also to earn income when ploughing other fields and charging a fixed rate. She also dreams to support her children with good education facilities and for that she means to save as much as possible and is determined to do a good business for the future.

She needs loan to expand her store business. She wants to stock groceries items to sell such as potatoes, dal and rice for that matter. Likewise, the rest of her group members too need loan to facilitate their respective income activities. Among the group, four members undertook piggery farming, Two members do weaving, and another two members raise goats to sell and one member sells clothes.

loans.use: To increase the store inventory of rice, potatoes, and dal (lentils).

loans.name: Ekhlas

texts.en:
Ekhlas, who is the applicant for this loan, is a 41-year-old conservative woman. For cultural reasons, she asked her husband (who will be using the loan funds in his business) to appear in the photo in her place.

Ekhlas is a homemaker, looking after their four-member family. Her husband works as a driver and sells used clothes, to support his family. He collects the clothes and either sells them by the piece, or by kilo to other sellers in the market. Now Ekhlas wants to support her husband, so she applied for this loan to enable him to get a larger quantity of used clothes, at a wholesale price.

loans.use: to help her husband support the family, by enabling him to get a larger quantity of used clothes at a wholesale price, to resell in his business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old, married, and supports a family of five. Her four children are 19,17,14, and 12 years old. Pauline sells fresh milk and has been in the business for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Pauline is servicing her fourth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) after successfully repaying the previous loan.
