She also said "I believe that with my store I also provide a service to my village. Here, there is little trade and the people are looking for places to make purchases. That is why I supply my business with a little bit of everything."

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, broth, soap, fried foods, canned goods, juices, soft drinks, sweets and cookies to re-stock her business.

For the future, Ana Esther wants her business to prosper and to expand to supply more goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, broth, soap, fried foods, canned goods, juices, soft drinks, sweets and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abduljaleel

texts.en:
AbdulJaleel is 61 years old and married. He is a father of three boys and one girl.
 
AbdulJaleel has a clothing store in an active area, from which he is supporting the family and paying for his children's school. Now, AbdulJaleel has applied for a loan to buy a new collection of winter clothes that he doesn't have to add variety and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Sabta

texts.en: Sabta is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and four children. To support the family financially, Sabta's husband works at two jobs while she works in their small-sized food store selling snacks and basic food products to families in the neighborhood. Sabta has applied for a loan to bring in some goods requested by her customers and to add a better quality of products to her store.

loans.use: to bring in some requested goods

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 25-year-old young married man with no children yet. For the past three years, he has been selling home products from his store, which is situated in a good location in the center of the market and is well known among customers. His business is profitable and is his only source of income; however, it needs more support from time to time to cover some costs.

Momen is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN (see below) to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of home products to sell. This will increase sales and improve his income positively. Momen is photographed inside his store. About Shariah-compliant lending: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 38, is from Kutaisi district. He lives with his wife and 2 children. David requested a  loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small amount earned by David, who works as an artisan. It is hardly enough for food for a four member family. According to Credo's estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved because of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, David will purchase a truck. After purchasing this truck, he plans to trade vegetables. He will buy vegetables from wholesalers then transport and resell at better price. This will increase his family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a truck and start trading vegetables.

loans.name: Seccion 7 Group

texts.es:
El grupo sección  7, esta ubicada en una comunidad donde la principal actividad económica es la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar y su gente es muy amable, trabajadora y alegre. Este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas:
Roman-Venta de refrescos
Maria Elizabet-venta de calzado
Virginia-venta de tacos
Ana Bertha- Venta de ropa
Serafin-venta de refrescos

Roman tiene la edad de 36 años, es soltero y estudio preparatoria . El platica que hace mas de 15 años tiene en un pequeño local en su hogar una refresqueria la cual abre todos los días de 9:00 de la mañana hasta que se va el ultimo cliente.

Cuando el inicio este negocio  fue porque en su pueblo hay pocas fuentes de empleo y el quería ayudar a su madre y darle una mejor y darle una mejor calidad de vida.

El invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de refrescos, jugos, galletas, dulces y frituras para resurtir su refresqueria.

El quiere a futuro hacer una pequeña remodelacion de su negocio y seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
The group, section 7, is located in a community where the dominant economic activity is the planting and cultivation of sugar cane. The people are very friendly, hardworking and cheerful. This group is composed of 5 people:
Roman- Sells soft drinks
Maria Elizabet- Sells footwear
Virginia- Sells tacos
Ana Bertha- Sells clothing
Serafin- Sells soft drinks

Roman is 36 years old. He is single and finished high school. He says that for more than 15 years, he has had a small place in his home, a snack bar, which is open every day from 9 in the morning until his last customer.

When he began this business, it was because his town had few sources of employment and he wanted to help his mother and give her better and improve their quality of life.

He will invest the credit in the purchase of a variety of soft drinks, juices, cookies, sweets and fried foods to re-stock his snack bar.

For the future, he wants to do a small remodel of his business and continue to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, juices, cookies, sweets and fried foods.

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en: Buthaina is a 38-year-old married woman. Her husband is a police officer and they have a 2-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son. Buthaina has a small beauty salon in Al-Mafraq. She wants to provide other services besides hair dressing and has decided to start offering facial treatment services. Buthaina did a lot of searching for good products to use in her salon and has now applied for this loan to buy facial treatment masks and hair treatment products.

loans.use: to buy facial treatment masks and hair treatment products

loans.name: Alondra Group

texts.es:
Alondra es un grupo integrado por 7 personas trabajadoras y amables este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad cuya unica fuente de empleo es el campo en la recoleccion de resinas de arbol de hule y cultivo y siembra de caña.

Doña Ausencia desde hace mas de 4 años tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, Ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder contribuir con el gasto del hogar.

Doña ausencia tiena la edad de 31 años, estudio solo primaria, esta casada con Jose  y tiene 3 hijos.

lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que no solo gana su propio dienero sino que esta enseñando a sus hijos que  en la vida se sale adelante trabajando ya que algunas ocasiones ellos la ayudan a despachar.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de productos enlatados, aceite, jugos, frijol, sal, arroz, sopa, azucar, arina, dulces, refresco, chile, tomates y cebolla para resurtir su negocio.

Ella espera a futuro su negocio siga creciendo y surtirlo mas  para dar a su familia una mejor vida.  

Este grupo agradece a Vision Fund por el apoyo que les brinda con estos prestamos.

Los demaas integrantes del grupo son:

Alberta venta de pollo
Maria Elizabeth Venta de refrescos y dulces 
Maricela venta de pasta de mole
Piedad venta de ropa interior
Adan venta de pan 
Alberta venta de dulces
texts.en:
Alondra is a group made up of seven hardworking and kind people. This group is located in a community whose only source of employment is collecting resin from rubber trees and cultivating and planting sugarcane. 

Ausencia has had a small grocery shop in her home for over four years. She decided to set up her own business in order to contribute to household expenses.

Ausencia is 31 years old, was educated only to primary school level, is married to Jose and has three children. 

Her favorite thing about her business is that she not only earns her own money but that she is teaching her children that in life you succeed by working, because they sometimes help her to sell.

She will invest this loan in buying a variety of canned products, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, sweets, soft drinks, chillies, tomatoes and onions to restock her business.

She hopes that in the future her business continues to grow, and that she can stock it with more products to give her family a better life. 

This group is grateful to Vision Fund for the support it gives them through these loans.

The other members of the group are: Alberta, who sells chicken; Maria Elizabeth, who sells soft drinks and sweets; Maricela, who sells Mole paste; Piedad, who sells underwear; Adan, who sells bread, and Alberta, who sells sweets

loans.use: to buy a variety of canned products, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, sweets, soft drinks, chillies, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza, 38 years old, is from the small village of Tskaltubo. He lives with his wife, 2 children and his mother. On several occasions, Zaza has requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but has had no success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's only source of income is from agricultural activities. They have a cow, whose milk is used in dairy products, which they sell locally in an open market at a good price. However, it is hardly enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative through Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Zaza will use this loan to purchase tires and an accumulator for his truck. After fixing up his truck, he will be able to get orders and transport goods. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires and an accumulator for his truck

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en: Jamil is a 32-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is married and has 5 children. Jamil operates a business buying and selling food. His business is located along a busy street, thus attracting many customers. Jamil has been able to use his business proceeds to pay school fees for his children. He obtained his capital from a hide and skins business that he still operates. Jamil hopes to open new outlets in other trading centers despite the challenge of capital. Jamil intends to use the loan to buy products such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old farmer in Kitale county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children, three of them still in school. She has been farming for the past twenty years, producing milk, maize and beans, which she sells at the local market. Margaret runs a hotel as an additional source of income.

Margaret wants to venture into poultry farming. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. She will sell the poultry products and earn extra income to help her increase her livelihood and pay for her children’s schooling. Margaret's major farming challenges are poor transport networks and high competiton. She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years. Margaret hopes Juhudi Kilimo will introduce school fees loans in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia tambien sigue vendiendo productos de libreria como cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite y cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
This member continues to run her grocery store and sells primary needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She has been in this business for eight years and things are going very well for her.  She’s had the business for eight years and works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She also continues selling stationary items, such as notebooks, books, and pencils.  She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, notebooks, books, and pencils.

She is grateful and values this loan that will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, 40 years old, lives in a small village in the Tetritskaro District with his wife and two children (5 and 22 years old). The family's only source of income is Rashid's monthly salary working locally as a shepherd.

Rashid requested a loan to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative through Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Rashid will use this loan to purchase a milk cow, which he will place in the old cattle shed located in his yard. Rashid will start the production of cheese and sell it at the local open market. The family's income will increase by 150-200 Laris, a 45–60% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz, 61 years old, is married to Catherine and they have been blessed with four children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 4 years. Boaz has been a dairy farmer for 28 years and his current monthly income is KES 9,000.

Boaz is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase more dairy cows. He plans to reinvest the profit in the business. This is Boaz' second loan and he successfully repaid his previous one. His hopes and dreams are to continue with his dairy farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer humilde nacida en al paramo de la ciudad de Ambato, Rosa tiene 50 años es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 13 años, ella sigue trabajando airosa y con mucha fuerza, Rosa  se define como una persona muy reservada, alegre, Rosa ama mucho a su hijo y le encanta el campo, es por ello que desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de dos vaconas para la crianza y cuando ya estén las harán reproducir y se dedicaran a la distribución de leche, Rosa comenta que el trabajo del campo es sacrificado pero lo hace con amor  ya que su hijo la ayuda y pone muchas ganas para brindarle a su hijo de amor y cubrirle de todo lo el necesite.
El sueño que doña Rosa tiene es el tener una pequeña finca con muchas cabezas de ganado para ser distribuidora de leche y vender en los mercados y en las comunidades aledañas donde ella vive.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is a humble women born in the moor of of Ambato. Rosa is 50 years old, is a single monther and his a child that is 13 years old. She continues working gracefully and with much strength. Rosa defines herself as a very reserved person and happy person. Rosa loves her son very much and also loves the countryside. It is for that reason that since a small girl she has been in agriculture and the raising of animals.
The loan requested of FODEMI will be invested in the purchase of two cows to raise and when they are able to reproduce they will be dedicated to the distribution of milk. Rosa says that the farm work is sacrificial, but she does it with love since her son helps her and it provides good income to her loving son and covers all the necessities.
The dream that Rosa has is to have a small farm with many cattle for being a distributor of milk and selling in the markets and in the surrounding communities where she lives.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 2 cows for raising and reproduction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textbooks and exercise books.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 22 years old. She is married with two children ages 2 1/2 years and 2 months. Her husband is a businessman who sells cloth. She has been in the clothing sales business for four years. She wants a loan to buy more cloth for tailoring. With the profit she will buy food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret used her previous loan to purchase four bales of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps for her retail shop.

Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 6,000. She is now borrowing KES 60,000 to buy four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps to sale.

loans.use: To purchase four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 33 years old. She is married with three children ranging in age from 1 to 8. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in the retail clothing business for six months. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Drocela

texts.en: Drocela is 31 years old. She is married with one child who is 6 years old. Her husband is a soldier. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more bedsheets and window curtains. With the profit she will finish her house.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and window curtains for sale.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 20 and youngest is 13. Her husband is a builder. She has been in business for 15 years. She wants a loan to buy more bed sheets. The profit will pay for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 27 años de edad, es un ejemplo vivo de que para salir adelante lo único indispensable son las ganas de querer hacerlo. Cuenta que cuando terminó el bachillerato su abuelo le prestó un local para que montara su propio negocio y con sus ahorros decidió crear una miscelánea, en la cual labora diariamente de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche. 
Marisol es madre soltera de una niña de seis años de edad, a la cual puede dedicarle el tiempo necesario gracias a que labora como independiente. “Esta es una de las grandes ventajas” manifiesta ella. Su mayor sueño es poderle ofrecer a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y acceso a la educación. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos de papelería con el fin de poder atender la demanda de la temporada escolar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 27 years old. She is a living example that willpower is the only thing in life that you need to move forward. 

She says that when she finished her bachelor´s degree, her grandfather loaned her a place to start her own business. With her savings, she decided to open up a corner shop, where she works laboriously everyday from 9:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night. 

Marisol is a single mother with a 6 year-old daughter. Thanks to her self-employment she can dedicate as much time as necessary to her. "This is one of the greatest advantages," she says. 

Her dream is to offer her daughter a higher quality education and life. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy stationary materials so she can meet the demands of the school season and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy stationary materials for her corner store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Fuerza Y Unión Group

texts.es: Circe es una chica con ganas de salir adelante, ella es originaria de una localidad donde hay  varias tradiciones y hacen fiestas de pueblo muy bonitas y pintorescas. Circe es parte del grupo llamado Mujeres en Fuerza y Unión, platica que una conocida de ella perteneciente al grupo fue quien la invito para que pudiera hacer su propia estética ya que ella estudio una carrera técnica de cultora de belleza en una población cercana a la de ella. Dice que tiene un año que terminó sus estudios y que ha trabajado en varias estéticas pero a ella le gustaría tener su propio negocio ya que varias de las clientas que tenía cuando trabajaba en otros lugares le han dicho que corta muy bien en pelo y que les gusta como hace las cosas como pedicura y manicura. Es por eso que ella se está animando a pedir el préstamo por que quiere comprar material para poner la estética en su casa y comprara cepillos, peines, tijeras, tintes, tubos, shampo, utensilios para hacer manicura y pedicura. Dice que ella se siente agradecida por que le harán el crédito ya que podrá montar su propia estética y eso la tiene contenta y  feliz. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman María Luisa, Marisol, María Verónica, Irma, Mario, Luz María, María del Carmen y Fanny ellos invertirán en artículos para papelería, en artículos para tienda de abarrotes, para insumos para estética, insumos para hacer y vender antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Circe is a girl who wants to get ahead.  She's from a town with a variety of traditions as well as pretty and picturesque town celebrations.

Circe's part of a group called Mujeres en Fuerza y Unión.  She says an acquaintance who belonged to the group invited her so she could set up her own beauty shop.  She studied cosmetology in a town near her own.  She says she finished school a year ago and has worked in various salons.  She would like to have her own business, though, because some of her customers have told her she cuts hair very well and they like how she does pedicures and manicures.

This is why she's encouraged about requesting a loan, because she wants to buy materials to set up the salon in her house.  She's going to buy brushes, combs, scissors, dye, curlers, shampoo, and manicure and pedicure tools.

She says she's grateful they're going to give her the loan because she'll be able to set up her own salon, and this makes her content and happy.

The other members of the group are María Luisa, Marisol, María Verónica, Irma, Mario, Luz María, María del Carmen, and Fanny.  They will invest in supplies for a stationery store, a grocery store, a beauty salon, and making and selling Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy materials to set up a beauty salon

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. The oldest is 2 years and the youngest is 2 months. He has been in business for 10 years. He sells food stuff and wants a loan to buy more. With the profit, he will buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock, 28 years old, is single. He has been in business for 3 years. Enock wants to use this loan to buy more pants. He will put any profit into his savings.

loans.use: To buy more pants to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: T´jiaru Group

texts.es: Elia tiene 23 años, es originaria de una comunidad indígena ubicada en los límites de Michoacán y Estado de México, donde la mayoría de las personas hablan el dialecto Mazahua. Elia es una mujer trabajadora y varias de las integrantes del grupo llamado T’jiaru la invitaron porque saben que es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Dice que es la primera vez que entra a un préstamo y que está entusiasmada por que con el crédito ella cree que  mejorara su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda, dice que empezó este negocio porque donde trabajaba como empleada domestica en la ciudad de México la que era su patrona le regalaba la ropa que ya no ocupaba y a veces a ella no le quedaba y mejor ella la empezó a vender a la gente de su comunidad, después ella empezó a ir a los tianguis a surtir ropa la cual la vende en su comunidad dice que lo que mas vende son ropa para niños y la vende en pagos para que a sus clientas no se les haga caro y puedan comprarle más. Dice que es un buen negocio porque así ella esta al pendiente de su hijo  pequeño el cual tiene 3 añitos y asi también puede aportar algo de capital a su casa. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Aurelia, Karina, Alejandría, Rocío y María Clara ellas invertirán en sus negocios de cultivo de aguacate, cría y venta de borregos, surtir zapatos por catalogo, para la compra de maíz para hacer tortillas a mano.
texts.en: Elia is 23 years old. She is originally from an indigenous community located within the boundaries of the state of Michoacán, México, where the majority of the people speak the dialect Mazahua. Elia is a hard working woman and several of the members of the group called T’jiaru invited her because they know that she is a responsible and hardworking woman. She says that it is the first time that she is entering a loan and that she is enthusiastic because with the loan she believes that she will improve her business. She sells secondhand clothing for a living. She says that she began this business because where she worked as a domestic employee in México City, her customer gifted her clothing and that was not being used and she began to sell to people from her community. After she began to go to the flea market to stock clothing to sell in the community, she said that she sold mostly children's clothes and at prices that are not expensive so her customers can buy more. She says that it is a good business because although her small son is dependent on her, as he is only 3 years old, she can also contribute to the expenses of the house. The other members of the group are named Aurelia, Karina, Alejandría, Rocío and María Clara. They will invest in their businesses of cultivating avocado, raising and selling sheep,  supplying shoes by catalog and the purchasing of corn to make tortillas by hand.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothes and shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario de 57 años de edad,  es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las labores del campo, oficio que aprendió gracias a su padre. 
En la actualidad se dedica a la siembre de cebolla, flor y cilantro; legumbres que vende en el pueblo el día domingo. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia por lo cual su gran desafío es esmerarse por sacar una buena cosecha. 

Su mayor reto son los cambios climáticos a los que se enfrenta en varios periodos del año, el calor y el invierno arrasan con sus cultivos ocasionándole grandes pérdidas.
Desea poder ampliar su capacidad de producción, ya que tiene parte del terreno inutilizado, pero para ello a recurrido a un crédito debido a que no cuenta con los recursos para realizar dicha inversión. El dinero lo utilizará en la compra de abonos, riegos y semillas.
texts.en:
Mario is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  All his life he has been working in the fields, having learned this from her father.

He currently raises onion, flowers, and cilantro; vegetables that he sells in town on Sundays.  This is his family’s only source of income and his challenge is to work hard in order to have a good harvest.

His greatest challenge is the climate change that he faces at various times of the year.  The heat and the winter harm his crops with occasional large losses.

He wants to be able to expand his production capacity since he does not use a part of the land, but he needs a loan to be able to make this investment.  He will use the money to buy compost, irrigation, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah, a 26-year-old single guy, lives with his nine siblings and parents. Abdullah is a hardworking man. He works in the daytime as a teacher in a school, and after school he goes to work in his small dairy factory that he established recently. He has applied for this youth loan to buy more stainless steel pots for the milk boiling process and other needed tools.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel pots

loans.name: Luz Alba

texts.es:
Luz Alba de 59 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y guerrera, toda su vida se dedicó a las labores del hogar y a cuidar de su hijo. Hace 7 años decidió montar una tienda en su casa para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación.

Sueña con poder surtir su negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor calidad en el servicio, así como aumentar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Luz cuenta que cuando inició su negocio tuvo muchas crisis debido a que su esposo se quedó sin empleo y los gastos comenzaron a incrementarse hasta el punto en que la tienda no pudo sostenerse y se quebraron. Luego de mucho sacrificio volvieron a levantarla y hoy van en progreso. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará un congelador para diversificar sus productos e incrementar el surtido.
texts.en:
Luz Alba is 59 years old. She is a resourceful and determined woman who has been engaged in caring for her house and her children throughout her life. 7 years ago she decided to set up a shop in her house in order to help her husband paying for their expenses and to provide her son with a better education.

She dreams of supplying her shop and of providing a better service to her customers; she also dreams of increasing her sales and of improving her family’s standard of living. Luz tells us that they were going through a big crisis when she opened her shop, as her husband had lost his job and their expenses increased to the point where the shop could not be sustained and they went bankrupt. They have then succeeded in reopening it with many sacrifices and now things have progressed. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to supply her shop with different products and increase her products range.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus tres pequeños, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padres y madre para él, lamentablemente María no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser Administradora, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, las cual le servirá de mucho ya que podrá conservar y preparar sus alimentos, de esta manera María mejorar la salud e higiene de ella y su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: María is a 41-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her three little ones. Her children are her main reason for living and she loves them dearly. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic woman. She puts her all into getting her children ahead, as she is both mother and father to them. Unfortunately, Maria was not able to study for a career, but she would have really liked to be an administrator. In her free time, she enjoys watching television. She sometimes cooks delicious ceviche for her family. On her own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, Maria works as a field labourer for a large farm in her city. She works every day from the early hours of the morning, and is able to work for approximately ten hours per day. She feels happy with her work and thinks that it is going well for her because of her good performance and for the kind way that she treats others. Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a stove. This will help her to preserve and prepare her food. This way, she will be able to improve her family's health and hygiene. She will also be able to keep working toward achieving her greatest dream: to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase a stove.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Ms. Bashiran is 42-year-old active, married woman. She has been efficiently running a business of hand-embroidery at her home for the last five years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life, as her husband’s income as a laborer is not sufficient to meet everyday expenditures of the household.

She is a loving mother of five children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase spools of thread and packs of sequins, glitter and pearls in different colors to complete customers' orders on time. She desires to spend part of the income on providing good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread and packs of sequins, glitter and pearls in different colors to complete customers' orders on time.

loans.name: Yudieth Evelina

texts.es: Yudieth Evelina de 35 años de edad casada con tres hijos 6,12 y 14 todos menores de edad, solo el menor estudia, ella es propietaria de un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y refrescos vende sus productos en la terminal de buses, ella los prepara en su hogar inicia este negocio junto con  su esposo quien siempre la ha apoyado, con unos ahorros que tenían, ella pretende terminar de construir su casa, ya que le faltan algunos detalles  y en su negocio pretende surtir más sus ventas para captar nuevos clientes, Yudieth poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio, ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar un juego de mesas plásticas con sus sillas y también comprar productos básicos para la elaboración de las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
Yudieth Evelina is a 35-year-old married woman with three children aged 6, 12 and 14.  Only her youngest child is in school.

She is the owner of a small business that sells food and drinks at the bus terminal.  She prepares these items in her home.  She started this business with her husband, using some savings that they had. He has always supported her.  

She intends to finish building her house, since there are some tasks that still need to be completed.  She plans to stock her business so that she can gain new customers.   

Yudieth has managed little by little to build her business.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy a set of plastic tables and chairs and also buy ingredients so that she can prepare her food items.

loans.use: to stock her food stall with food and drinks, and also to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 37 años, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, el cual es su razón de vivir. Debido a al falta de oportunidades para emplearse en su municipio, San Luis, Colombia, Miriam optó por dedicarse a la venta de productos por catálogo, actividad que le permite estar pendiente de su hijo y generar ingresos para su sostenimiento. 
Miriam recorre las veredas de su municipio en búsqueda de nuevos clientes con el fin de vender sus productos y generar una buena rentabilidad. Su sueño es poder montar su negocio en el casco urbano, pero sabe que para lograrlo requiere de tiempo y disciplina, por el momento se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para financiar la compra de nuevos productos de belleza y salud, los cuales le han solicitado en repetidas ocasiones pero que por falta de recursos no ha podido comprar.
texts.en:
Miriam is a thirty-seven-year-old mother of a three-year-old son, who is her reason for living.  Due to the lack of employment opportunities in her city of San Luis, Colombia, she decided to begin selling products through catalogs, which allows her to be available to take care of her son and to generate income for their sustenance.

She travels throughout her city searching for new customers so that she can sell her products and achieve a good profit.  Her dream is to be able to establish her business in the city center, but she knows that achieving this will require time and discipline.

Currently she is seeking a loan so that she can buy new health and beauty products.  Customers have asked her for these products on repeated occasions, but for lack of resources she has not been able to purchase them.

loans.use: to buy Santé health and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Orfilia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 66 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos,  vive en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de Intibucá junto a cuatro de sus hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace 10 años estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, azúcar, manteca, condimentos, harina, jugos, churros, especies, productos enlatados, refrescos, pan, café y otros. Además genera otros ingresos vendiendo ropa y calzado por pedidos. Doña María ha obtenido 14 préstamos con este que solicita actualmente, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en compra de más producto para la pulpería y compra de ropa y calzado. Ella quiere tener productos en inventario para satisfacer a los clientes. Su sueño es ver más surtido su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Maria, 66, is married and has 6 children.  She lives with 4 of her children in a community in the municipality of Intibuca.  Maria has always worked in retail trade.  Ten years ago, she started a small grocery store where she sells basic consumer goods such as: rice, sugar, butter, condiments, flour, juices, chips, spices, canned goods, drinks, bread, coffee, and other items.  She also generates some other income by selling clothing and shoes through orders.  

Maria has taken 14 loans.  With the loan that she is now requesting for an amount of 15,000 Honduran lempiras, she will invest in the purchase of more products for her store and more clothing and shoes.  She wants to have products in inventory to satisfy her customers.  

Maria's dream is to see her business well-stocked, so that she can provide better service to her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy food products, including: rice, beans, sugar, flour, salt, coffee, bread, drinks, chips, and canned goods, and also to buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de progresar en la vida, Cuenta que aprendió el oficio cuando le dieron la oportunidad de laborar en un taller de confección. Cuando lo perfeccionó compró una máquina de coser y comenzó a realizar costuras desde su casa a sus vecinas, para estar pendiente del cuidado de sus hijos. En conjunto con su esposo montaron el taller para confección a terceros. Esta actividad les ha permitido salir adelante ofreciéndoles a su familia un buen futuro y mejores oportunidades de educación a sus tres hijos.

Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio e incrementar el nivel de producción y para lograrlo se encuentran solicitando un crédito que destinará en la adecuación del local -sala de la casa- realizando reparaciones en la instalación eléctrica para optimización de tiempo.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is 49 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a deep desire to progress in life. She told us that she has been given the chance to work in a sewing workshop and that it was there that she has learned her activity. Once she became more expert she bought a sewing machine and she sewing clothes for her neighbors in her house, so that she could also care for her children. Together with her husband she set up the workshop to fashion clothes for third parties. Through this activity she has succeeded in getting ahead, granting a good future to her family and better education opportunities to her three children.

Her biggest wish is to expand her activity and to increase her production rate; in order to achieve her goal she is requesting a loan that she will use to adapt her locale – the room in her house – having the electricity system repaired to optimize her working time.

loans.use: To repair the electricity system of her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Granito De Arroz Group

texts.es: Ma. Angelina tiene 50 años de edad y es originaria de un lugar pintoresco donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías en madera o piezas para el hogar en madera ya que la región es rica en pinos y cedros. Muy cerca de esta comunidad se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca de México y donde cada año las mariposas arriban desde Canadá a dar un hermoso espectáculo y donde van miles de turistas a visitar el santuario. Angelina es parte de un grupo llamado Granito de Arroz, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de ocoshal el cual la materia prima la sacan de las palmitas secas que tiran los arboles y de ahí hacen hermosas artesanías como, bolsas, servilleteros, fruteros, canastas, tortilleros, alhajeros y muchas cosas más, también hace bordados artesanales como servilletas para tortillas, carpetitas tejidas para decoración, manteles, almohadones y muchas cosas más los cuales sale a vender al santuario de la mariposa monarca ya que allá los puede vender en mejores precios, platica  que cuando no es temporada de mariposa una prima le ayuda a vender las artesanías en la ciudad de México, dice que esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar, hilos en diferentes colores, agujas, aros, marquice (tela), estambres y muchas cosas mas. Ella esta agradecida por que le harán el crédito ya que tendrá material para poder hacer sus artesanías y poder aportar capital a su casa. Las otras 15 integrantes del grupo se llaman Martina, María Guadalupe, Lourdes, Eduwiges, Rosa, Alicia, Ma. Isabel, Marisol, Laura, Rocío, Leticia, Arcelia, María de Jesús, Ma. Guadalupe y Mayra ellas invertirán en zapatos y ropa por catalogo, en tienda de abarrotes, en surtir frutas y legumbres, en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos etc.
texts.en: Angelina is 50 years old and is from a picturesque area where the majority of the people are engaged in making crafts from wood or stone. The region has abundant pine and cedar trees. Very close to this community is the national Monarch butterfly sanctuary of Mexico, where every year these butterflies arrive from Canada. They put on a beautiful show, and thousands of tourists come to visit the sanctuary. Angelina is part of a group called "Granito de Arroz". She makes crafts from ocote leaves that fall from the trees. Beautiful crafts are made from these, such as purses, baskets, napkin rings, fruit bowls, tortilla holders, trinket boxes and many other items. She also makes decorative rugs, tablecloths, pillows and other crafts that she takes to sell at the butterfly sanctuary, since she can obtain good prices there. She reports that when it is not the butterfly season, a cousin helps her sell her crafts in Mexico City. She is seeking a loan in order to buy thread in different colors, yarn, cloth, needles, rings and many other items. She is grateful for this loan opportunity as this will help her obtain the materials to make her crafts and bring income to her household. The other fifteen members of the group are named Martina, María Guadalupe, Lourdes, Eduwiges, Rosa, Alicia, Isabel, Marisol, Laura, Rocío, Leticia, Arcelia, María de Jesús, Guadalupe and Mayra. They will use the funds to purchase shoes and clothes from catalogs, groceries, fruits and vegetables, Mexican snacks, and other goods.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors, yarn, cloth, needles, rings and many other items.

loans.name: La Lupita Group

texts.es: Teresa o Doña Tere como de cariño le dicen es originaria de una comunidad ubicada entre los límites del estado de Michoacán con el Estado de México, ella es una mujer trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, platica que tiene 44 años de edad y no le dieron estudio sus padres ya que antes se creía que las mujeres tenían que cuidar sus hijos y estar en su casa haciendo las labores domesticas. Dice que a ella le gusta mucho el estar en su casa pero que ella pensó en también tener su propio capital para asi ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de los hijos y de la casa es por eso que ella decidió cultivar aguacate ya que tienen un terreno muy amplio y para trabajarlo decidió plantar aguacates ella dice “hace un poco mas de 15 años compre unas plantas de aguacate con la esperanza que algún día sacara cosecha, ahorita soy una de las mujeres que vende más aguacate en su población ya que tengo 150 árboles de este fruto y me siento orgullosa porque entre mi esposo y yo le hemos echado muchas ganas para sacar adelante nuestro huerto, cada año sacamos varia toneladas los compradores vienen hasta nuestra población ya que vendemos fruto de muy buena calidad”. Platica que ella eta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, calidra para mejorar sus árboles. Ella esta agradecida por que con el crédito podrá mejorar su negocio. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Antolina, Maria Santa, Maria del Carmen, Maria Elena, Gilberta y Teresa ellas invertiran sus creditos en insumos como fertilizantes, abonos,insecticidas, calidra para mejorar sus huertos de aguacate y planta del mismo fruto.
texts.en:
Teresa, affectionately known as "Doña Tere," is native to a community located within the boundaries of the state of Michoacán in Mexico State.  She is a hard worker and wants to get ahead in life.  She is 44 years old.  Her parents didn't send her to school because people thought at the time that women had to take care of the children and domestic chores.  

Teresa likes staying at home but she also thought that she would like to make her own money in order to help her spouse with the expenses for the children and house.  For this reason, she decided to grow avocados.  They own a broad plot of land and decided to plant avocados to put the land to use.  Teresa says: "A little more than 15 years ago I bought avocado plants with the hope that one day they would yield a crop.  Now I am one of the women in my community selling the most avocados, given that I have 150 trees of this fruit.  I am very proud that my husband and I together have made many gains in getting ahead with our garden.  Each year tons of buyers come to our town because we sell very high quality fruit."  

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, organic fertilizers and calidra (to prevent plagues) in order to improve her trees.  She is grateful that with the loan she can improve her business.  The other members of her group include Antolina, Maria Santa, Maria del Carmen, Maria Elena, Gilberta and Teresa.  They will invest loan proceeds in buying fertilizers, insecticides, and calidra to improve their avocado orchards and plant more of the same.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and calidra (to prevent plagues) for cultivating avocado crops.

loans.name: Reina Lucía

texts.es:
Doña Reina de 50 años de edad es una mujer que no se paraliza ante las adversidades de la vida, siempre anda en búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan crecer y aprender. “Detrás de la oscuridad siempre llega la luz” esta es la frase que emplea Reina para contarnos como surgió la idea de crear empresa. Después de que su esposo se quedara sin empleo decidieron invertir la liquidación de las prestaciones sociales en el montaje de su propio negocio; adecuaron una de las habitaciones de su vivienda y comenzaron vendiendo papelería gracias a un colegio aledaño de su casa. Posteriormente fueron invirtiendo las ganancias en la compra de ropa y calzado, hasta formar el almacén que hoy administran.
Hoy se encuentran solicitando un crédito que utilizaran en la compra de artículos para la temporada encolar con el propósito de incrementar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos que les permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina is 50, she is a woman that doesn't get paralized by life's challenges, she is always looking for new opportunities that allow her to grow and learn.  "there is always light after darkness" is the phrase Reina used to tell us how she came up with the idea to start a business.  After her husband lost his job, they decided to invest the severance payment in the start of a business; they adapted some of the rooms in their home and began selling school supplies because of a school that is close to their house.  Later on they invested profits in buying clothing and shoes, and they now have a larger store that they manage.  Today they request a loan that will be used to buy school season products with the goal to increase sales and generate more income that allows them to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy products for the school season.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo de 55 años, está casado y es padre de un hijo de 12 años de edad. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a laborar en oficios varios  a fin de conseguir el alimento y el dinero para sostener su hogar. Hace siete meses decidió invertir sus ahorros en la compra de mecatos y dulces los cuales vende desde la sala de su casa.  Esta idea de negocio surgió debido a los fuertes dolores de columna que le impidieron seguir laborando en oficios pesados. Luis espera que su nuevo proyecto le genere buenas ganancias porque es su única fuente de sostenimiento para el y su familia. Según observaciones y por sugerencia se sus vecinos don Luis se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de legumbre, ya que en el sector no hay nadie que preste este servicio.
Sueña con poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y adecuar su vivienda, ya que la lluvia en muchas ocasiones la ha destruido por el material en la que se encuentra Construida.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 55 years old and he has a 12-year-old son. All of his life he has been engaged in different activities in order to earn the money for his family and to grant them their staple food. Seven months ago he decided to invest his savings in the purchase of cakes and sweets that he sells from a room of his house. He has come up with this job idea because his severe backache prevents him from engaging in heavy jobs. Luis hopes that his new project will grant him a goof income as this is the only source of income he has to provide for himself and his family. By observing his neighbors and taking their advice Luis has decided to ask for a loan to buy pulse, as no one else in his area sells this type of product.
He dreams of being able to grant a better standard of living to his family and to make improvements to his house, as the rain has destroyed it many times because his house has not been built with waterproof materials.

loans.use: To buy pulse.

loans.name: Musalam

texts.ru:
Мусаламу 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она трудолюбивая и порядочная женщина. Более 37 лет она работает механизатором. Мусалам очень хорошо знает свою работу, а также имеет опыт и навыки в земледелие. Она хочет найти новый источник дохода, путем организовать новый бизнес. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своего ребенка с хорошим образованием. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Musalam is 49 years old and she is married with one child at home.  She is a dedicated and organized woman.  For more than 37 years she has worked as a machinist.  Musalam knows her job very well, and she also has experience and skills in agriculture.  She wants to find a new source of income and a way to start a new business.  With that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  She wants to start her business buying and selling livestock.  She plans to use the income from that venture to pay for her child's education.  She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy livestock to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Giovannia Maria

texts.es: La señora Giovannia mujer trabajadora, comerciante desde hace 4 años, habitante del municio de Ticuantepe, su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada como Auxiliar Contable, entre los dos han sacado adelante a su Hija y sobre todo esta trabajando para poder ver su sueño cumplido que es  terminar su casa, con los creditos que Afodenic  le ha brindado la ha contruido pero todavia le falta algunas modificaciones, con este nuevo prestamo comprara lo siguiente: Puertas y Ventanas.
texts.en: Mrs. Giovannia is a hard-working woman.  She has been in business for 4 years and lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  Her husband works for a private business as an assistant accountant.  Between the two they have been able to help their daughter get ahead.  Giovannia works above all to see her dream accomplished which is to finish their house.  With the loan from Afodenic she has been able to build the house but is still lacks some modifications .  With this new loan she will buy the following: doors and windows.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Reinaldo De Jesús

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un campesino de 35 años de edad del municipio de Marinilla, Colombia. Desde su niñez conoce de las labores del campo debido a que su familia siempre ha residido en el mismo lugar. Laboró con su padre por más de 10 años, hasta que tomó la decisión de independizarse. En la actualidad cuenta con 2500 matas de sembrados de tomate y pimentón, los cuales requieren de abonos, para sacar una buena cosecha. Por esta razón Reinaldo se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que comprará insumos agropecuarios y de este modo generar una producción de calidad.

Su gran sueño es poder comprar una parcela, para realizar sus siembras y construir una vivienda para su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad, ya que en la que se encuentra en estos momentos es de su padre.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a farmer of 35 years of age from the municipality of Marinilla, Colombia. He learnt about farm work from when he was a child since his family has always lived in the same place. He worked with his father for over 10 years until he decided to become independent. At present he has  has 2500 tomato and paprika seedlings which require fertilizer in order to obtain a good harvest. For this reason Reinaldo is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies and in this way generate quality produce.  

His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can sow his crops and build a house for his wife and two-year-old son, since he is currently living in his father's house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Se dedica al alquiler de trajes para toda ocasión. Esta actividad surgió después de laborar por tres años en una casa de novias. Allí aprendió todo lo relacionado con el negocio, hasta que tomo la determinación de independizarse. 
Sus hijos se han convertido en el mayor apoyo para ella, y en la motivación que la impulsa a levantarse diariamente a comenzar su faena. 
Su mayor sueño es poder posicionar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a la universidad y formarse como profesionales.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima-Telas-, con el propósito de ofrecerles a sus clientes una nueva línea de productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 40, is a single mother of two children. She rents suits for all occasions. This activity came after working for three years in a bridal shop. There she learned everything about the business, until she made the decision to become independent.

Her children have become her biggest support and motivation which drives her to wake up daily and begin her job.

Her biggest dream is to position her business and increase her revenue to offer her children the opportunity to go to university and be trained as professionals.

Today she is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials-fabrics, in order to offer her customers a new product line.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials-fabrics.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 49-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Salome has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, insecticide, seeds and a bush knife. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Salome hopes to pay for her children's education next year.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, fertilizer, insecticide, seeds and a bush knife.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 69 años, es una persona muy responsable, feliz, solidaria, carismática y sobre todo trabajadora con deseos de superarse cada día más. María vive con su esposo en Pelileo una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Ambato. María  se dedica a la comercialización de leche y a la crianza de animales le encanta el campo, es por ello que desde pequeña se dedicó a esta actividad.
María solicito un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra vacas lechera para incrementar la producción de leche ya que quiere seguir emprendiendo en el negocio de la venta de leche, esta inversión ayudará a María a obtener mayores ganancias, lo que ayudará a mejorar la economía de su hogar. 
María sueña en tener una finca propia donde pueda criar ganado lechero para crear fuentes de trabajo y ayudar con esto a las personas que más lo necesitan y sobre todo mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 69 years old. She is a very responsible, happy, caring, charismatic and above all a hard worker with a desire to overcome every day. Maria lives with her husband in Pelileo, a rural parish in the city of Ambato. Maria works in the trade of dairy and livestock breeding. She loves the countryside, which is why since childhood she was devoted to this activity.

Maria is requesting a loan from FODEMI to invest in the purchase of dairy cows to increase milk production as she wants to continue undertaking in the business of selling milk. This investment will help Maria to earn more, which will help improve her household finances.

Maria dreams of owning a farm where she can breed dairy cattle to create jobs and help others who need it most and above all improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding and milk production.

loans.name: Semiperive

texts.en: Semiperive is 22 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Semiperive has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, soy sauce and tomato sauce. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Semiperive hopes to buy some new furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chicken legs, soy sauce and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Dúo 4 De Febrero Group

texts.es: El dúo 4 de febrero está integrado por Olga originaria de Sumpango,es casada y madres de familia, todos los días se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias pero los días que aprovechan mas son los días sábados y domingos que es cuando  la gente compra más de lo común comenta que le ha ido muy bien con las ventas a pesar de que hay mucha competencia ella ha sabido ganar  la confianza de sus clientes por tal razón solicita un crédito ya que se aproxima la época navideña y es en donde vende mas ya que ella necesita aumentar sus compras para así poder vender más de lo de siempre, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
texts.en: The two member team called February 4th includes Olga, a native of Sumpango, who is married and has children.  Every day she works selling clothing and sandals but the days when she sells the most are Saturdays and Sundays because that is when people purchase the most.  She comments that things have gone well for her in sales despite there being a lot of competition.  She has learned to earn the trust of her customers and for that reason she is asking for aloan since the Holiday season is here and that is when she sells the most.  She needs to increase her sales in order to sell more than normal.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase new clothing for sale.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for sale.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de "Santa Rosa" esta conformado por siete integrantes seis mujeres y un hombre pero todos son muy responsables y trabajadores ellos platican que el nonbre decidieron ponerselo porque asi se llama la patrona del pueblo es una de las virgenes mas celebradas en la comunidad donde ellos viven.
Doña Cristina es una integrante del grupo platica que tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Silverio desde hace 36 años juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos sinembrago ya todos son independientes Doña Cristina tiene una tienda de abarrtes que inicio despues despues que pusiera su puesto de antojitos mexicanos desde hace cuatro años, comenta que le gusta mucho vender tener a sus clientes contentos, esta vez esta solicitando el credito a la institucion para comprar mas mercancia para abastecer su teinda ya que actuamente le fhacen falta varios productos como pan, huevo, leche, refrescos, sabritas etc. Cuenta una mala experiencia "Yo anteriormente no tenia ningun interes en los creditos solo que un dia le ofrecieron y tuve que tomarlo ya que unos hombres me robaron toda mi mercancia me quede sin nada por lo que mi vi forzada a tomar el prestamos para sacar adelante mi tienda, el asalto me hizo mas fuerte y asi pude salir adenate" Doña Cristina comenta que no ha tenindo otro problema mas grande que el asalto del que fue victima. La meta de Doña Cristina es hacer mas grande mi tienda y volver a la venta de comida que es lo que anteriormente vendia comida corrida, Los integrantes del gupo tambien estan solictando el credito para invertierle en sus negocios, Don Jose Luis y Elizabeth invertiran para juegos pirotecnicos, Rafaela y Teresa en borregos,  Luisa y Magdalena invertiran en la compra de ropa.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa Group is made up of seven members, six women and one man. All are very responsible and hardworking. They chose this name for the group because Santa Rosa is the patron saint of their town, and she is one of the most famous virgins in the community where they live.

Doña Cristina is one of the members. She is 52 years old and has been married to Sr. Silverio for 36 years. They have six children, all of whom have now left home. Cristina has a grocery store which she opened after running her Mexican snacks stall for four years. She says that she very much enjoys selling things and making her customers happy. She is now seeking a loan from the institution to buy more stock for her store such as bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, and Sabrita snacks.

She relates a bad experience she had: “In the past I had no interest in loans. But then one day I was offered one, and I had to take it because some men stole all my stock. I was left with nothing, so I was forced to take a loan to restart my business. The robbery made me stronger and so I am able to get on with my life.” Cristina says she has had no problem bigger than being the victim of a robbery. Her goal is to expand her store and start selling meals again, a job she used to have.

The other members of the group are also seeking money to invest in their businesses. Don Jose Luis and Elizabeth wish to invest more money in their fireworks business, Rafaela and Teresa want to buy sheep, and Luisa and Magdalena wish to invest money in their clothing business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, eggs, milk and Sabrita snacks etc.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, de 28 años, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y sobre todo muy trabajadora, convive con Hemilton y junto a el tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad, vive en su casa propia  a lado de todos ellos y es ahí donde diariamente le hace frente a las adversidades para salir adelante.
La actividad que realiza Marianela es la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, leche, aceite, huevos, azúcar, fideos y bebidas gaseosas, para eso estableció una pequeña bodega en su propia casa, ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano de manera amable y cordial a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos con quienes tiene una relación de amistad y respeto. Su bodega lleva funcionando recién 6 meses, generalmente atiende sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja.  Le agrada su negocio  de ventas de abarrotes ya que le permite estar en casa durante el día y participar en las actividades escolares de sus hijos y de su hogar, así mismo, el ingreso económico que obtiene le ayuda a solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene hasta la fecha tiene planes de continuar con su actividad y realizar la ampliación y mejora de su pequeña tienda. Este es el crédito número 1 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, del mismo modo, asegura sentirse tranquila trabajando con su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000), comprará mayor cantidad de diferentes productos y abarrotes para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marianela, 28 years old, is a very hardworking, enterprising and happy woman. She lives with Hemilton, with whom she has two children, who are 10 and 6 years old.  She lives with all of them in her own home and it is there that she confronts the difficulties of getting ahead every day. 

Marianela has a business selling groceries, such as rice, milk, cooking oil, eggs, sugar, noodles and soft drinks. She established a small grocery store in her home where she waits on customers in a cordial and friendly manner everyday, starting very early in the morning. The majority of her customers are her neighbors with whom she has a friendly and respectful relationship. Her store has been in operation for 6 months and she generally works alone, although she gets help from her partner occasionally.

She likes her grocery store business because it enables her to be at home during the day and participate in her children’s school activities as well as perform household duties. In addition, the earnings she receives help her to pay for basic family expenses. Seeing the good outcome that she has had until now, she has plans to continue with the business and to expand and improve her small store.

This is Marianela’s first loan from MFP. She is very pleased to know that she has financial support because she feels more confident about succeeding in her work. She is also committed to making her payments on time and assures that she is comfortable working with her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive.

With the sum of S/. 1,000 requested, she will purchase greater quantities of different products and groceries so that she can provide greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of different products and groceries so that she can offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, actualmente está separada del hombre con quien compartió sus días por muchos años, tiene 9 hijos mayores de edad, vive en su casa propia que obtuvo como resultado de su unión de pareja y la comparte solamente con una hija, ambas ponen el mayor esfuerzo para tener una vida confortable. El trabajo de Paquita consiste en la compra y venta de plátanos y diversos granos como maíz, frijol, soya y otros de acuerdo a la temporada. Todos los días ella se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse al puerto principal de la ciudad para conseguir los productos que luego pone a la venta en el mismo lugar o en ocasiones vende al menudeo en su propia casa. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable porque sus ganancias son muy buenas. Lleva en ésta actividad cerca de 7 años y siempre a trabajado con apoyo de sus hijos o en ocasiones con la ayuda de algunos colaboradores quienes cargan los racimos de plátano o los pesados sacos de granos.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que tiene buenos ingresos, la única dificultad que encuentra es que tiene que levantarse muy temprano, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y tiene que continuar poniéndole muchas ganas para conseguir el dinero suficiente que requiere para cubrir sus necesidades, espera seguir trabajando igual y más adelante comprar su propio bote de pesca. Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste financiamiento, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará 25 sacos con maíz cuyo valor unitario es de 45 soles, con el monto restante comprará racimos de plátanos para venderlos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
57-year old Paquita is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is now separated from her husband, but their marriage lasted for many years. She has nine adult children and lives in her own house which she obtained through her marriage. She shares it with a daughter, and both put in a lot of effort to make a comfortable life for themselves.

Paquita earns her living buying and selling bananas and grains such as maize, beans, soya and others depending on the season. She gets up early every day to get to the main entry to the town where she obtains the items she will then sell at the same place or from her own home. She says that her business is profitable as her income is very good.

Paquita has been doing this work for about seven years and has always had help from her children, or from other people who load the bunches of bananas or the heavy sacks of grain for her. She really enjoys her work as it brings in a good income. The only difficulty she has is having to get up very early. However, she knows that this is part of her work and she has to continue putting in a lot of effort to earn the money she needs to buy necessities. She expects to continue working in this way and later on buy her own fishing boat.

This is Paquita’s eighth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for this loan opportunity and for the trust put in her. On her part she promises to pay back the money punctually. She is grateful to be part of a community bank where the members are responsible, committed people. 

With the money she is seeking (S/. 2000), she plans to buy 25 bags of maize. One bag costs 45 soles. With the rest of the money she will buy bunches of bananas to sell from her house.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of maize and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Margaet

texts.en: Margaret is 24 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as onions, flour, rice, and soft drinks. She has been doing this for two years. Margaret needs a loan to restock her shop. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Sofia has requested a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, and sprayers. She became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Sofia hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, a wheelbarrow, and fertilizers

loans.name: Olepa

texts.en: Olepa is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She keeps a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Olepa has requested a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, and sprayers. She became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Olepa hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy veggie seeds, fertilizers, sprayers, and shovels

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Майрам успешная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Уже несколько лет она работает в средней школе, учительницей. Кроме педагогической профессии, она умеет ткать ковры ручного изделия. Она любит своё ремесло и работает с удовольствием. Майрам решила реализовать своё ремесло в бизнес и таким путем заработать деньги.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она уже в состоянии организовать свой бизнес, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки сырья для производства ковров, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mayram is a successful, ambitious woman. She is 27 and married with one child.
Mayram has been working as a middle school teacher for a few years. Apart from teaching, she makes carpets. She loves and enjoys her craft.
Mayram has decided to turn her craft into a business and to make money from it. To this end, she enrolled in the "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" program organized by the Association of Women in Business and received a certificate. She is ready to start her business but lacks the money to.
Mayram is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy materials for making carpets so she can start her business. She appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: to buy materials for making carpets

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Riya works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Riya is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo for weaving to sell in her buy-and-sell bamboo-weaving business.

Riya has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell bamboo for weaving

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is a 36-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small sewing business. She has four years with this business. Rosa needs a loan to buy needles, threads, material, and a new sewing machine. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Rosa joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and materials

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 56-year-old widow with five children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Viamora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Viamora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Viamora is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Viamora has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Daybee

texts.en:
Daybee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling weaving bamboo in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell in her buying and selling weaving bamboo business.

Daybee has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from a general store.
