Daybee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and married with three children. She plans to start a business selling fishing gear. She has requested a loan to buy new fishing gear for her business. 

Ana will use her profits to provide her children with education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en: Palepa is a 70-year-old widow with eight children. She makes and sells food like donuts, pork buns, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Palepa needs a loan to purchase goods for her canteen. She plans to use her profits to help supplement her family income. Palepa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, soya sauce, and sugar

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 18 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling curry and rice in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cartons of chicken, bags of rice, onions, flour, a gas oven, curry powder, paper plates, and foam cups. In the future, Christine hopes to earn more profit to improve her business and help with her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, flour, and curry powder for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es: El grupo "Evenecer" esta integrado por 6 integrantes son personas que se conocen desde siempre por lo regular siempre han vivido en la comunidad donde se reunen son personas muy trabajadoras con ganas de triunfar el nombre del grupo lo eligieron las integrantes del grupo el significado no lo saben con precision pero se lo pusieron porque que significa "Dios esta aqui" y ademas porque es un grupo que ha durado mucho tiempo trabajando con la institucion, Doña Angeles quien es integrante del grupo tiene 55 años de edad esta casada desde hace 39 años con le señor Julio juntos formaron una familia con nueve hijos de los cuales todos ya todos son independientes de dicha pareja, Doña Angela como comunmente la conocen  es una mujer ya mayor de edad pero esto no la detiene con la realizacion de sus sueños ella esta solicitando un credito a la instituhcion para comprar mas mercancia como fantasia productos de plasticos y jarceria, desde hace 35 años Doña Angela decidio iniciar con la venta de estos productos en los mercados platica que la inicio porque queria ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos para que pudieran tener una mejor calidad de vida, la dificultad que presenta es no tener un lugar estable donde ellos puedan ofrecer sus productos ya que las autoridades correspondientes se lo impiden vender fuera del mercado, Doña Angela platica que hace tiempo ellos fueron victimas de robo en otro estado para la familia de Doña Angela fue un gran susto aunque ella agradece a Dios porque los asaltantes no le hicieron daño a ningun familiar solo se llevaron la mercancia pero parala señora Angela fue un gran susto apesar de esta mala experiencia que paso continuo con la venta de sus articulos porque para Doña Angela y Don Julio lo mas importante era el bienestar de sus hijos, "Me gustaria algundia llegar a tener un local estable donde yo y mi esposo pudieramos vender nuestra mercacia tranquilamente ya somos personas mayores de edad y es muy dificil andar en el mercado ofreciendo nuestros productos" Doña Angela y el grupo estan muy contentos por el credito otorgado ya que los ayudara a invertir en sus negocios como Don Albino invertira en almohadas, Amelia en jarceria,  Felisa y Hermenegilda invertiran en controles para televisores, Sabina en productos de electronica.
texts.en:
The group "Evenecer" is made up of six members, people who have always known each other as they have always lived in the community where they meet. They are hard workers with a desire to succeed. The name of the group was chosen by the members however the meaning is not precisely known, they chose it because it means "God is here" and because it is a group that has worked for a long time with the institution.

Angeles, a member, is 55 years old. She has been married for 39 years to Julio and together they have nine children all of whom all are independent.  Angela, as she is commonly known, is an older woman yet this doesn’t stop her from achieving her dreams. 

She is requesting a loan from the institution to buy more merchandise such as plastic products and household products. Thirty-five years ago Angela decided to sell these products in markets she says because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses and the education of their children so they could have a better quality of life. The difficulty is not having a stable place where they can offer their products as the authorities prevent them from selling outside the market. 

Angela says that not too long ago they were victims of theft in another state. For Angela’s family it was a scare but she thanks God that the thieves did not hurt any family members, they only took the merchandise but for Angela it was a big scare. In spite of this bad experience, she continued selling her articles because for Angela and Julio the most important thing was the welfare of their children, "One day I would like to have a stable location where my husband and I could sell our merchandise peacefully as we are already seniors. It’s very difficult to walk in the market offering our products.” 

Angela and the group are very pleased for the loan granted as it will help them invest in their businesses; Albino will invest in pillows, Amelia in household products, Felisa and Hermenegilda will invest in remote controls for televisions, and Sabina in electronic products.

loans.use: to sell household products such as vasos, spoons, blender cups, etc..

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda lives in the Philippines. She is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a store selling charcoal and general supplies. Glenda requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF, Kiva's field partner, to purchase additional sacks of charcoal plus sugar, coffee, canned goods, and other stock. 

She has been in this business for 6 years, and in the future she hopes to save enough money to expand the store.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal plus sugar, coffee, canned goods, and other stock.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, 41, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a vendor, and a mother to her children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Criselda operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell it for a little profit. Her products are men's and women's clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Criselda hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear products like ladies' wear, menswear, kids' wear,  and other merchandise items to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Lufilufi

texts.en: Lufilufi is a 52-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small business cutting grass. She has been in this business for two years. Lufilufi needs a loan to buy a new grass-cutter and other things. She will use her profits to improve her business. Lufilufi joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a grass-cutter, gloves, and boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
Dellie has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. As a married parent of one child, she works hard to support her family.

Dellie is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her bamboo weaving business. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. Dellie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for weaving bamboo

loans.name: Kapeneta

texts.en: Kapenta is 51 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making pancakes and pork cakes to sell in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, oil, mutton, a large cooking pot, and a gas oven. In the future, Kapeneta hopes to grow this business to help her family and kids and also to continually grow her profit. She joined SPBD, Kiva's field partner, in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, cooking oil, mutton, a large cooking pot, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages, to resell in her store

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Karla, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, con mucha decisión y ganas de progresar. Es madre soltera, tiene 01 hija  Karla de 06 años de edad a quien cría y educa  con el   esmero que solo una madre puede hacerlo.  Vive en su local alquilado junto a su querida hija,  lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poderle brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Karla consiste a la venta de calzados variados. El local comercial donde realiza su actividad está ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Todos estos productos los compra en la capital,  entre los que ofrece a sus clientes tiene sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos nuevos y de segunda, tanto de varones como mujeres, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y baratos.
Empezó con su actividad hace más de 03 años donde trabaja sola y día a día y aprendiendo cosas nuevas.
Considera a su negocio  bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo siendo muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería, le está yendo muy bien ya que tienen una muy buena cartera de clientes quienes van en busca de sus productos cómodos y de buena calidad.  Espera en un futuro cercano tener una tienda más grande de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 07 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta porque contará  con un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo. Sabe que tiene que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual.  Está feliz  de pertenecer su banco comunal pues  considera  que son muy solidarios.
Sobre el préstamo:	
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería consistente en calzados como zapatos y zapatillas de diversa marcas y modelos de damas, caballeros y niños, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, ya que desea armar su campaña de fiestas patrias en el mes de julio  y así tener listo los calzados para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karla is 41 years old.  She is a simple and hardworking woman who is very determined and eager to get ahead.  She is a single mother to one daughter who is six years old.  She raises and educates her with the care that only a mother can provide.  She lives in a rented space together with her beloved daughter.  All she wants is to work very hard to provide her daughter with a better quality of life.  

Karla works selling shoes.  The store where she works is located in the central area of the city.  She purchases all of her products in the capital.  She offers her customers sandals and running shoes both new and used for women and men.  Her business is very busy since her products are new and low-priced.  She started her business three years ago.  She works alone and every day learns something new.  She believes that her business is profitable because of the demand for her products and the good income she earns.

She likes her work and feels very happy when she sells all of her merchandise.  It is going very well because she has a good set of customers who come in search of her comfortable products of good quality.  She hopes that she will have a larger shoe store in the near future where she can sell to her customers with more comfort.  

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is very happy because she has financial backing so that she can increase her working capital.  She knows that she has to be very responsible and above all very punctual.  She is happy to belong to her community bank because the members are very supportive.

With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase more merchandise such as shoes and slippers of various brands and models for women, men, and children.  She is looking for low prices for her purchases by buying in larger volume since she wants to stock up for a sale during a national holiday in July so that she will have shoes ready for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear such as shoes and slippers in various brands for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Peolo

texts.en:
Peolo is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a business venture sewing clothes. Peolo has many years of experience in this line of business.

Peolo needs a loan to get new equipment for her sewing. She hopes to use her profits for her children's education and for the family's everyday needs. Peolo joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, materials, and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her corn field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ambrosio, a driver, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, Lorena manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorena offers manicure and pedicure services. She already has regular customers in her community, and they contact her when they need her. She provides home services. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, cuticle pushers, nail cutters, and other tools and supplies she needs to carry on her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lorena hopes to have a happy family and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tools and supplies to use in her manicure and pedicure business, like a manicure bowl, nail polish, tweezers, and nippers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda engages in a direct selling business in their village. She has been in this business for 10 years. Erlinda also has a stall in a public market. She sells underwear, bras and some ready-to-wear products of Natasha and Avon.

With her passion to succeed and make her income bigger, Erlinda also walks around their village and gets her customers to order products. At present, it is peak season for a business like she has. Erlinda is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fragrances, lotions and beauty products to sell to her customers. Erlinda believes that by availing herself of the loan she will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fragrances, lotions and beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is 55 years of age, married, and has three school-age children. Debbie manages a sari-sari (convenience) store in their village. Among other things, she sells snack foods, soap and soft drinks. Debbie proudly says that she and her husband run the business. They don't have farmland for an additional source of income, but they are doing their best to meet their family's needs.

Debbie's and her husband's priority is to support their children who are in college. They don't waste any opportunity that will help them pursue their children's college level of education. Debbie wants to add new products to those she offers to her customers, but she can't do it because she doesn't have enough capital. Debbie is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy spices, shampoo, canned goods and beverages, to resell. In the future, Debbie will see her children become degree holders and professionals.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her store, like spices, shampoo, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Dúo Orquideas De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Orquideas de Sumpango. Este Duo esta integrado por la señora Elsa tiene 31 años de edad es soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos a mano, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, es  por esa razon que está solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos espera que le puedan apoyar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Elsa is 31 years old and single.  She is a member of the Dúo Orquideas de Sumpango group.  She works making fabric by hand and selling it.  She has done this work for ten years.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies to make traditional fabrics.  She hopes that you can support her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to create traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Elma has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
This is Noraida, she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noraida hopes to expand her business and dreams to have more businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a retail clothing business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from variety store. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of slippers, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing for her business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities with her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of slippers, pants, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing for her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old, married, and has six children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and has previously received loan funds through Kiva.

Teresita aspires to save money, to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his house to install a corn on the cob stand.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Mareta needs a loan to buy all of the ingredients for her business. She plans to use her profits for her family's daily needs and also to improve her business. Mareta has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and pork.

loans.name: Vaimutia

texts.en:
Vaimutia is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Vaimutia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, and a pair of gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Vaimutia hopes to improve her business to help her family and support her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a spade, a hose, a wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, weed spray, and a pair of gloves

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Gerlyn earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Gerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
This is Enriqueta, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ronnie, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Enriqueta operates a fruit stand, where she sells different kinds of bananas. She buys a large quantity of bananas and sells them by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy different kinds of bananas, to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Enriqueta dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different kinds of bananas, to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is a 20-year-old, married woman, who has one child. She has a small piece of land, and she grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Ruta has requested a loan to buy tools and farm inputs for growing her crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Ruta hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies she needs for growing taro and bananas, like a bush knife, wheelbarrow, shovels, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, age 56, is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Rosita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a restaurant in the market.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
En la cálida Ciudad de Aguaytia caracterizada por su clima cálido y su flora y fauna hermosa, vive Cristian el cual tiene 29 años de edad y vive al lado de su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos, quienes son su adoración y sobre todo son el motivo para luchar cada día y sobre todo porque son el regalo mas grande que dios le ha dado. Cristian solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera encantado estudiar ingeniería agronoma
Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Cristian logro iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, Cristian cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque trabaja con muchas ganas.

Cristian esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para poder re modelar su negocio como pintura, tablillas, mesas, sillas, entre otros,l de esta manera el podrá brindar a sus clientes un mejor ambiente y sobre todo mas comodidad, de esta manera mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Cristian lives in the warm city of Aguaytia which is known for its warm climate and beautiful flora and fauna.  He is 29 years old and lives together with his partner and their three children who he adores and are his motivation to fight every day because they are the best gift God could have given him.  Cristian only studied until the fifth year of secondary school because he could not afford to continue, but he would have liked to have studied agricultural engineering.  

With a lot of effort and saving, Cristian was able to start his business selling soft drinks and beers.  He works there around ten hours a day and has about ten customers a day.  He believes that the business is going well because he is friendly with customers and he works very hard.  

Cristian is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase materials to remodel his business, including paint, shelves, tables, seats, and other items.  This will allow him to provide a better environment and more comfort for his customers so that he can increase his income and continue working toward his ultimate dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as paint, chairs, tables, and shelves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nuualuga

texts.en: Nuualuga is a 74-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells ice-cake in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Nuualuga needs a loan to buy ingredients needed in her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Nuualuga has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy foam cups and sugar.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
This is Elvera, 39, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, an employee, and is a mother of children. Together with her husband, Elvera manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvera operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvera earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvera hopes to have a car and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell in her business.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta is 20 years old and single, with no children. She runs a small business, selling ice-cakes in her community. She has been doing this for many years. Ruta has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed for making her ices. She joined SPBD in 2011, to gain access to capital. With her earnings and with future loans, Ruta will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foam cups,sugar, and other supplies and ingredients for making ices to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dúo Los Pedregales De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo los pedregales de Sumpango.
este duo esta integrado por la señora Maria Narcisa, de 59 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 35 años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de tamales espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Maria Narcisa is part of the group Dúo los pedregales de Sumpango and is 59 years old. She works in the preparation and sale of tamales. She has been working in this activity for the past 35 years. She is applying for this loan for the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of tamales. She hopes that you can help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for the preparation of tamales.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga works hard to earn a living. She is married and has one grown child, who is already married. Dominga has operated her retail store and vegetable stall for 20 years. She offers different kinds of vegetables and merchandise. Dominga's profit goes to medication for her husband, daily household expenses, payment of the rent for use of her stall, and maintenance of her hog-raising business.

With her determination to have viable sources of income, Dominga is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000. She will use this loan to buy different kinds of vegetables, such as cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions and garlic, and some merchandise to sell in her retail store and vegetable stall.

She believes that she could attain her goal through continuous financial assistance of lenders to her. Dominga hopes to use this loan to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as cabbages, carrots and tomatoes, and some merchandise to sell in her retail store and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
“La vida se encuentra llena de retos y de sueños por cumplir” con esta frase Paula Andrea de 29 años nos cuenta como inició en su oficio como manicurista. Desde niña siempre tuvo claro que el área de belleza era su fuerte, pues en el colegio todas sus compañeras la buscaban para que las peinara y les maquillara las uñas, de esta forma fue adquiriendo la habilidad, hasta que la perfeccionó en una academia. Posteriormente se dedicó a laborar como independiente con servicio a  domicilio.

Su mayor pasión es su trabajo, ama lo que hace y lo disfruta ciento por ciento. Sueña con poder montar un salón de belleza pero aún no cuenta con los recursos para hacerlo, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y surtido para dar los primero pasos de su gran proyecto. Paula espera que esta inversión le genere los ingresos suficientes para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Life is full of challenges and dreams to achieve.”  With this sentence, 29 year old Paula Andrea tells us how she began her career as a manicurist.  Since she was a little girl, she always knew that beauty was her strong point because all of her schoolmates sought her out for hairstyles.  This is how she began learning and then perfected the skill in a trade school.  Later she began working out of her home.

Her greatest passion is her work.  She loves what she does and she enjoys it 100%.  She wants to start her own salon but doesn’t have the necessary resources to do it, so she is requesting a loan to buy a display case and inventory to take the first steps in her grand project.  Paula is hoping that this investment will generate the necessary income to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a display case.

loans.name: Kony Alexander

texts.es: La señora Kony junto a su esposo quien labora como mecanico, trabajan muy duro para salir adelante ella trabaja la Tierra cultivando Piña, su sueño es poder darle a sus tres hijos mejores condiciones en el hogar. actualmente requiere de insumos para poder darle Mantenimiento a sus cultivos de Piña ya que si no se le aplica a tiempo y forma al fruto puede perder la cosecha, Gracias a este nuevo credito comprara los siguientes insumos: Urea, Triple 20, Gespax, Herbicida. Se siente muy contenta y Agradecida con Afodenic quien atraves de Fondo Kiva la han Apoya.
texts.en: Kony and her husband, who is a mechanic, work very hard to make headway. She works farming pineapple, and her dream is to be able to give her three young children better living conditions at home. She currently is in need of supplies to maintain her pineapple crops, and she can lose the harvest if she doesn't apply the materials in time. Thanks to this new loan she will be able to purchase the following supplies: urea, Triple 20 fertilizer and herbicides. She feels very content and is grateful to AFODENIC, which has supported her through Kiva loans.

loans.use: to maintain her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Fuatai

texts.en: Fuatai is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a small business, making and selling biscuits in her community. She has been doing this for many years. Fuatai has requested a loan to buy ingredients that she will use to make biscuits. She joined SPBD in 2009, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuatai will expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, salt, and cooking oil, to use in making the biscuits she will sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.es:
La Sra. Ludivina ha vivido en esta ciudad desde hace treinta y nueve años, es una persona muy trabajadora, amable y emprendedora.
Por el momento solo vive del ingreso de su esposo que trabaja fuera de la ciudad y lo mira solo una vez al mes, debido a esto se ha visto en la necesidad de aperturar un negocio en un lugar que le rentarán  que se encuentra en el centro de esta ciudad, para sacar adelante a su único hijo que vive con ella, darle una mejor calidad de vida y así también ayudarlo a terminar sus estudios.
De la misma manera desea poder terminar de construir su casa con la misma ganancia que le resulte de su lonchería, negocio que aperturará con la ayuda de nuestra institución ya que desea comprar todo lo necesario para atender a sus clientes con la rica comida que solo ella puede preparar, vale la pena mencionar que la Sra. Ludivina tiene un muy rico sazón en sus comidas.
texts.en: Ludivina has lived in this city for the past 39 years. She is a very hard-working, friendly, and entrepreneurial person. At the moment she lives only on the income of her husband who works outside of the city and she sees him only once a month. Due to this, she has seen the necessity of opening a business in a place that she will rent in the middle of this city. She also wants to help her only son to get ahead, give him a better quality of life, and also help him finish his studies. In the same way she wishes to be able to finish constructing her house with the profits that will result from her lunch stall, a business that she will open with the help of our institution. She wishes to buy the necessary items to be able to attend to her customers with the delicious food that only she can prepare. It is worth mentioning that Ludivina has a very tasty flavor in the food she cooks.

loans.use: to buy goods for the opening of a lunch counter.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to enlarge and diversify her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and for the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Now Luzviminda would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more items to add to her inventory, like stand fans, wall fans, ceiling fans, rice cookers, and others. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs, and to cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Luzviminda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a house and lot. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more items to add to her inventory, like ceiling fans and rice cookers.

loans.name: Normanita

texts.en:
Normanita works hard to support her family. She has a local food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an income from a variety store. Normanita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF, to buy ingredients for her prepared foods business.

Normanita has been sustaining her business activities through five past loans from NWTF and, more recently, Kiva lenders. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, de 57 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy empeñoso. Está casado con Rosa quien es comerciante. Tienen un total de10 hijos a quienes crió y educo de tal manera que ya todos son independientes. Vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposa a quien desea seguir brindándole una mejor calidad de vida para así poder tener juntos una vejez tranquila.
El trabajo de Cesar consiste en la venta de calzados como zapatos, zapatillas, sandalias,  tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes productos nuevos y usados de acuerdo a sus gustos y necesidades. Cuenta con un pequeño local alquilado en una zona comercial, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. También ofrece el  servicio de arreglo de calzados malogrados.  Cuando se inició solo vendía productos de segunda, pero con el tiempo fue incrementando su capital y ahora puede vender nuevos. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por más de  06 años y desea continuar haciéndolo por muchos años más.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene sus productos dejándole buena ganancias.
Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite contar con una ocupación e ingreso económico además de tener la libertad de poner su propio horario y días de trabajo. Tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener buenos ingresos, espera en el futuro aumentar su capital y su stock de mercaderías para ver crecer su negocio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, está contento de contar con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, se compromete una vez más en pagar las cuotas de manera responsable.  Comenta sentirse muy cómodo en su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará más mercadería para su negocio como calzados de diversos modelos para damas caballeros y niños, de esa manera  aumentar la variedad que ofrece, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras para tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Cesar, aged 57, is a good, kind, and very diligent man. He is married to Rosa, a merchant, and they have ten children who they have raised and educated in such a way that they are already independent. He lives in his home along side his wife, to whom he wishes to continue offering a better quality of life so that they can have a quiet old age together. 

Cesar's work consists of selling footwear, like sneakers, shoes, and sandals.  He has both new and secondhand merchandise to offer his customers to suit their tastes and needs.  He relies on a small rented space in a commercial area of his town, where he kindly takes care of his customers.  He also offers a shoe repair service. When he began he only sold used merchandise, but with time his capital increased and now he can sell new shoes. He has been doing this work for more than six years and wants to continue doing it for many more years.  

He likes his job very much since it gives him employment and regular income, in addition to the freedom to set his own schedule and work days. He has good sales and this allows him to have good profits. In the future, he hopes to increase his capital and his stock of merchandise in order to see his business grow.  For that reason, this will be his 10th loan with MFP.  He is happy to have this financial support in order to continue with his goals. 

Once again, he promises to make his repayments in a responsible manner. He also says he feels very comfortable in his communal bank since his [fellow] group members are very responsible and always support each other. With the requested amount, 1200 soles, he will buy more merchandise for his business like shoes of different styles for women, men, and children.  This way, [he will be able] to increase the variety that he offers and find lower bulk prices for his goods in order to have greater profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his business like shoes of different styles for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She previously received a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase larger quantities and a bigger variety of grocery items and products to sell in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. With more items on display in the store, there will be more sales and better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Letecia hopes to expand her business and dreams of a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
This is Mia, 24, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, a fish vendor, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Mia operates a food stall. She sells snacks like bananaque (sugar coated banana) and other street food staples in her community. She also has a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she use in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mia dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sugar and gas for her business.

loans.name: Asaf Group

texts.es: El grupo “Asaf” está conformado por un grupo de mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables, viven en un lugar muy tranquilo y pequeño donde la gente se dedica al cultivo de maíz las integrantes del grupo cuentan que el nombre lo eligieron porque lo sacaron de la biblia, no saben con seguridad qué significa, pero les gusta. Se trata de un nombre evangélico y las integrantes creen que era el nombre de una persona que organizaba músicos. Nos cuentan que en el lugar donde viven celebra el día en que el evangelio llega al lugar. Doña Raquel quien es la representante del grupo plática que tiene 35 años de edad esta casada con el señor Ismael desde hace 19 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños de los cuales solo estudian dos. Doña Raquel desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de vasos de licuadora y productos de jarcería inicio su actividad porque desde pequeña sus padres se dedicaban a la venta de estos artículos y cuando se caso también su esposo Ismael se dedicaba a la venta de estos mismos productos asi que para ella ya no fue nada dificil adaptarse al trabajo, esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más productos como, espinzas, cucharas, vasos, vasos de licuadora, etc. Raquel Comento "Si me autorizan el crédito para mí y para mi esposo será de gran ayuda para poder invertirle al negocio ya que en mas tengamos variedades de productos nuestras ganancias podrán aumentar y asi nosotros podemos mejorar la calidad de vida de nuestros hijos" Aunque la dificultad de Doña Raquel es cuando sus ventas bajan mucho por lo regular es en el mes de febrero por lo regular son fechas en los que no venden casi nada, A doña Raquel le gustaría llegar tener un local mas grande donde pudiera tener mas mercancía. Los otros miembros del grupo son Agustina, Emma, Norma y Felisa quienes invertirán en productos de jarcería y Angélica invertirá en controles.
texts.en:
The group "Asaf" is formed by a group of women who are very hardworking and responsible, and they live in a very calm, small place where the people grow corn.  The members took the name of their group from the bible, and although they don't know exactly what it mean, they like it.  It is an Evangelical name, and the members believe it is the name of a musician.  

Doña Raquel is the representative of the group.  She is 35 years old, married to her husband Ismael for 19 years, and together they have a family with three children, two of which are studying.  Doña Raquel has sold blenders and household products for 15 years.  She began her business because, as a child, her parents sold these products and then when she got married, her husband Ismael also sold the same products.  It wasn't difficult for her to adapt to the work.  

This time Doña Raquel is applying for the loan to buy more products such as tongs, spoons, glasses, blenders, etc.  In regards to the loan, Doña Raquel said, "If they authorize this loan for me and my husband, it will be a great help to be able to invest in our business.  The more products we have, the better our sales will be and we will be able to make the quality of life better for our children."  The difficulty for Raquel is when sales fall drastically, and this typically happens in the month of February when they don't sell hardly anything.  She would like to have a bigger shop where she can have more merchandise.  

The other members of the group are Agustina, Emma, Norma, and Felisa who will all invest in household products, and Angelica who will invest in controls devices.

loans.use: to buy blenders and household products.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 40 years old, married with five children.  She has one child  in school.

Marieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marieta requested a 18,000 PHP loan to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marieta has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to sustain it.

In the future, Marieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercy Flor

texts.en:
Mercy Flor is 47 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Mercy Flor is borrowing 27,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.to buy feed and medicine for her livestock.

Mercy Flor has been raising livestock for 12 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

She works tirelessly toward achieving her dream of saving enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her livestock.

loans.name: Cristina Saime

texts.es:
Cristina es una joven muy carismática y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se encuentra en la selva peruana y acoge a muchas especies tanto animales como vegetales muy hermosas. Debido a  los pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración.

Cada día Cristina se levanta muy temprano para acudir a su centro de labores, Cristina trabaja como vendedora en un tienda de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, asimismo Cristina vende zapatos cuando se encuentra en la hora de refrigerio ya que con ello tiene un ingreso extra; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante.

Crsitina esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar zapatos de verano para ofrecer a sus clientes y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño: " Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Cristina is a young woman who is very charismatic and above all has a great will to advance. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is located in the Peruvian forest and is the home of many very beautiful species, animals as well as plants. Because of limited economic resources, she was only able to attend school up to the fifth year of secondary education, but she would have liked to study for a career in administration. 

Every day Cristina gets up very early to arrive at her workplace. She works as a sales person in a store in the city. She works about 9 hours a day, and with the fruits of her labor she is able to assist her parents with the household expenses. In addition, Cristina sells shoes when she is on her break, since with this she has some extra income. She believes that her work is going well for her because she is responsible and above all because she wants to get ahead.

Cristina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support that they have offered her, she will be able to buy summer shoes to offer to her customers, and thus she will be able to improve her income. In this way she will continue striving and exerting herself to be able to make her greatest dream -- to have her own house -- a reality.

loans.use: to buy summer shoes

loans.name: Miriam Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Miriam habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a sus hijos, Madre Soltera ha sabido salir adelante sola su mayor dificultad es que no puede reunir de una sola vez el dinero para construir su casa, ella quiere construir un cuarto anexo en la parte trasera de su casa para tener mejores condicines en la familia, Gracias al prestamo otorgado por Afodenic y Fondos Kiva comprara Materiales como: Bloques, Hierro, Cemento, Arena y Piedrin.
texts.en: Miriam lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her children.  A single mother, she has been able to come out ahead all by herself.  Her biggest challenge has been getting together enough money at one time to build her home.  She wants to build an extra sleeping quarter behind her house so that she can improve her family's living condition.  She is thankful for the loan from Afodenic and Kiva.  She will purchase materials like, blocks, brick, cement, sand, and stone.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Now, Lilia is borrowing Php 17,000 to purchase groceries for her general store. Her business was previously funded through NWTF and this Kiva field partner continues to provide Lilia and her family with an increased income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like bread, detergent, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa, 55 años soltera, 5 hijos  23,25,27,30 y 31 años de edad todos trabajan, ella inicia este negocio porque uno de sus hijos trabajaba en una panadería y él le insistió hasta que ella hizo su propio horno y hoy en día es un negocio estable que le deja buenas ganancias, Cándida con muchos esfuerzos logro sacar a sus hijos adelante, ahora ella está solicitando financiamiento para reforzar su capital de trabajo y comprar  materia prima como azúcar, harina, manteca, leña entre otros.-
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa is 55 years old. She is single and has five children, ages 23, 25, 27, 30 and 31. She started this business because one of her children was working in a bakery and he insisted that she open a bakery herself. 

Today, her business is stable and brings her a good income. With plenty of effort, Cándida has been able to support her children. She is now applying for a loan to reinforce her working capital by buying supplies such as sugar, flour, butter, and firewood, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to continue making baked goods.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 52, is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. Her husband is a construction worker and they have children. They manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lydia operates a tailoring business. She mainly sews curtains, bed sheets, blankets, rugs and other home needs. Seasonal demands for clothing and uniforms are also available. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lydia dreams that her business will grow and hopes for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles, cloth and other supplies needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a rug making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vulcanizing. Julieta is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like halcyon yarn, knitting needles and other tools for her rug making business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like halcyon yarn, knitting needles and other tools.

loans.name: Consuelo Antonia

texts.es: Consuelo de 48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 22,16 años, de los cuales el menor está bajo su responsabilidad está estudiando. Ella es originaria de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Consuelo es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora en la vida para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darle un futuro mejor,  y brindarles las oportunidades que lamentablemente   ella no tuvo por falta de recursos económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar enfermería.  Pero gracias a su espíritu de superación personal  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación, desde hace  7 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. La cual desempeña como mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda de comestibles donde se vende en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, huevos, sal, pan, leche, frijoles cosidos, caja de fosforo, cigarros por unidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos. Consuelo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 48 years old and married with two children, ages 16 and 22. Her younger child is studying and is still in her care. She is from Malpaisillo, which is located in the western part of the country.

Consuelo is a hardworking woman. She has fought to provide for her children and give them a better future by offering them the opportunities that she unfortunately never had due to a lack of financial resources. She would have liked to study nursing. Thanks to her spirit to overcome, she has a grocery store, or "pulpería," which is located in her home. A pulpería is a small store which sells products in small quantities, such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, eggs, salt, bread, milk, cooked beans, boxes of matches, and cigarettes. She has had this business for seven years, and she is happy with her work because it provides a livelihood for her and her family.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital by stocking her grocery store. She will then be able to offer a better service to her clients and increase her income in the near future.

Consuelo is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with goods such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, eggs, salt, bread, milk, cooked beans, boxes of matches, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Dúo Bethlehem Group

texts.es:
DUO BETHLEHEM

LO INTEGRA LA SEÑORA ESTERLINA, ELLA ES ORIGINARIAS DE SAN JUAN COMALAPA DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE CHIMALTENANGO, CUENTA CON SU NEGOCIO QUE ATIENDE EN SU CASA DOÑA ESTERLINA ES MADRE DE CUATRO HIJOS, TIENE SU VENTA DE TORTILLAS Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA TAMBIEN REALIZA TEJIDOS A MANO CON LOS INGRESOS QUE OBTIENE PUEDE APOYAR A SOSTENER SU HOGAR CON LA COMIDA Y ESTUDIOS PARA SUS HIJOS, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS A MANO Y VENTA DE ROPA.
texts.en:
Duo Bethlehem

Esterlina is a member of Duo Bethlehem. She is from San Juan Comalapa in the department of Chimaltenango. Her business is located in her home. 

Esterlina is a mother of four children. She sells tortillas and also has a second business, in which she makes handmade fabric. With the income she earns, she is able to help maintain her home and provide her children with food and an education.

She will use this loan to buy supplies to make handmade fabric and sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make traditional handmade fabric and sell clothing.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis con su anterior credikiva compró una maquinaria, con la cual cortar los huesos, compró carne en mayor volumen y vendió mucho más, y hasta le alcanzó para reparar la cubierta de su negocio. Él se encuentra muy feliz y en la época de navidades y de año nuevo, espera poder ofrecer  a su clientela,  quien incrementa para esa época el consumo,   los productos  que justamente él vende. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará carne de res, de carnero y porcina, pues sus clientes han aumentado y ahora tiene nuevos compradores, fuera del municipio de Malambo, donde habita y tiene su negocio. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Agradezco el apoyo que me han dado a mi y a mi famlia con estos créditos . Gracias a ustedes mi negocio ha mejorado mucho y espero seguir contando con el apoyo."
texts.en:
Luis used his previous Kiva loan to buy machinery for cutting bones.  He bought meat in quantity and sold much more.  He was also able to repair his business’ roof.  He is very happy about the Christmas and New Year’s seasons and he hopes to be able to offer his customers more products, since their consumption increases during this time.

This is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy beef, ram, and pork.  His number of customers has increased and he has new buyers outside of Malambo, where he lives and has his business.  His message to the Kiva lenders is, “I am grateful for the support you have given me and my family through these loans.  Thanks to you, my business has improved a lot and I hope to have your continued support.”

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of soft drinks.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosario

texts.es: Guadalupe del Rosario de 57 años de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad de 30,30 y 37 años todos trabajan, Guadalupe inicia su negocio por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad de trabajar ya que solo con su esposo trabajaba y era mucha la carga familiar porque sus hijos eran solteros y no trabajaban. De madera que junto con su esposo inicia el taller de costura y hoy en dia es un negocio muy conocido y de alto prestigio, el cual esta ubicado la ciudad de Chinandega. Guadalupe esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de bolsos, blusas vestidos para niñas, niños y adultos, los cuales entrega en tiendas y supermercados de Chinandega y su demanda a crecido.
texts.en: Guadalupe del Rosario is 57 years old, married, and has three adult children, ages 30, 30, and 37; all work.  Guadalupe started her business through her own initiative and because of a need to work because her husband did not earn enough and her children were single and didn’t have jobs.  She started a sewing workshop with her husband and now her business is very well known and highly prestigious.  It’s located in Chinandega.  Guadalupe is asking for a loan to buy supplies to make purses, blouses, and dresses for girls, boys, and adults.  She sells her items in stores and supermarkets in Chinandega and demand has increased.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is proud to share that through her income from the business, she is able to send her children to school. She is engaged in a vending business. With her bicycle which has a cart, she sells assorted vegetables, snack foods and fish in their village.
Mary Rose's business is in demand in their village because it is part of daily consumption especially during the planting and harvesting season. She wishes to obtain additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy fish, vegetables and snack foods to vend. She believes that the loan will be of big help to her to increase her income and to continue sending her children to school until college.

loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy emprendedor y entusiasta, día a día busca salir adelante, ya que espera ser el orgullo de sus padres y sobre todo apoyarlos con los gastos del hogar y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria ya que el solo ha podido estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria debido a sus pocos recursos económicos. Su vivienda se ubica en el cálido caserío del Carmen, Ica; la cual se caracteriza por su caluroso clima, así como también por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial el cultivo de pallares, esparrago, uva, entre otros.

Desde muy temprano Carlos Trabaja como chofer de taxi, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 cliente diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque desea salir adelante cada día.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá adquirir una radio base, la cual le va permitir poder contactar con una operadora para prestar su servicio a domicilio cuando los clientes llamen por teléfono; con esta gran ayuda el podrá atender a más clientes y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos, así el  seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very enterprising, enthusiastic young man who strives to get ahead every day so his parents will be proud of him.  His aim is to help them cover household expenses as well as pay for his university studies.  So far, he has not gone beyond high school due to a lack of resources.  His home is located in the welcoming community of Carmen, Ica, which is known for its warm climate and crop farming, especially lima beans, asparagus, grapes, etc.

Very early in the morning, Carlos starts his work as a taxi driver.  He works an average ten hours and attends to 25 customers a day.  He believes business is doing well because he is kind to his customers and works especially hard to get ahead every day.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he is able to buy a two-way radio to be connected through an operator to customers requesting his services by phone.  This will allow him to provide more service and increase his income so he can work toward his greatest goal:  "To own his own home".

loans.use: To buy a two-way radio.

loans.name: Rita Janeth

texts.es:
Rita Janeth
En santo  Tomas Milpas Altas encontraremos a Doña Rita Janeth, ella tiene 39 años de edad, y una hija  de 9 años, ella se dedica a la venta de Ropa, zapatos, y cosméticos, esta solicitando el crédito para la implementación de nuevos productos para su tienda, y tambien para la compra de material para dar clases de manualidades, juguetes, ropa de cama y regalos de temporada, su propósito es hacer crecer mas su tienda, y sobre todo darle estudio a su niña ya que su deseo es que su niña tenga mejor oportunidad en  la vida.
texts.en: Rita Janeth, 39, lives in Santo Tomas Mipas Altas with her nine-year-old daughter.  She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics, and is requesting a loan to add new products to her store inventory.  She also plans to buy materials for a craft class she will give, toys, bed linens and seasonal gifts.  Her aim is to expand her store and provide an education for her daughter, since she wants to give her the best opportunities in life she can.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Joissy Valeska

texts.es: Joissy es una joven de 22 años de edad,  madre soltera de un hijo, trabaja como despachadora en una farmacia, con el apoyo de su familia  paga la universidad ya que su salario es muy bajo y con dificultad le ajusta para los gastos de su pequeño, ella cursa la carrera de Química y Farmacia, está en la última etapa de su profesión por lo que tiene que entrar al curso de graduación lo cual es bastante alto el costo que ella no lo puede cubrir de un solo pago por esta razón Joissy solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar este curso que es muy importante para ella ya que con este logro, podrá obtener un mejor empleo y ayudar para el desarrollo de su hijo.
texts.en: Joissy, 22, is a single mother with a son.  She works as a pharmacy dispatch clerk and receives help from her family to pay for her university studies because because of her low salary.  It is hard for her to earn enough to cover her son's expenses.  She studies Chemistry and Pharmacy and is in the last stage of her education and about to start a master's degree, which is considerably expensive.  Therefore, Joissy is requesting a loan to pay for this course since it is important for her in order to get a better job and help in her son's development.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Dúo Misperal De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO MISPERAL DE SAN BARTOLO
Este duo esta conformado por doña Marta Lilia, ella tiene 47 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de temporada por mayor, a su cargo tiene cuatro hijos tres niñas y un niño, solo tres de ellos estudian ya que su hija mayor tiene 16 y es quien la ayuda a vender su producto ellas salen de San  Bartolo a las diez de la noche para viajar a Xela que es ahí donde venden sus frutas viajan dos veces a la semana,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y frutas para la venta.
texts.en:
DUO MISPERAL DE SAN BARTOLO GROUP

Marta Lilia, 47, sells wholesale seasonal fruits and vegetables.  She has four children, three girls and a boy, and three of them are students.  Her 16-year-old daughter helps sell the produce when, twice a week, they leave San Bartolo at 10 p.m. to travel to Xela.  The group is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Agelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica es una joven de 27 años de edad, se desempeña como radio terapista, ella es casada tienen 3 hijos por quienes vela por su educación y bienestar con el apoyo de su esposo, Angélica es estudiante de la carrera de química y farmacia, este es su último año en donde necesita recibir el curso de graduación lo que tendrá que pagar de un solo para poder obtener su titulo de profesión por eso ella solicita apoyo de crédito para cumplir con este gasto, lo cual es muy importante para ella debido que puede optar por un mejor empleo y garantizar el futuro de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Angélica is a young woman of 27 who works as a therapist. She is married and has three children whom she cares for with the support of her husband. She is a student pursuing a degree in chemistry and pharmacy who is in her final year of classes and only has to pay for one more to get her degree, so she is requesting the loan to cover this expense. It is very important to her because she will be able to get a better job and secure her children's future.

loans.use: to pay for a college course.

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. María Trinidad y su esposo el Sr. Jesús Rodolfo tienen un negocio de comida, ubicado en su domicilio.
El propósito de este, es  ayudar a las personas de la casa del peregrino fundación que ayuda a los migrantes que quieren pasar la frontera pero no lo logran, brindandoles hospedaje  y comida, la Sra. María Trinidad y su esposo hacen la comida a diario para ellos.
El crédito que sugieren  no solo será  un beneficio para ellos mismos, sino también para nuestros paísanos que quieren seguir el sueño americano.
Pero para esto es importante que surtan su negocio en compra de ingredientes para sus ricas comidas.
Vale la pena mencionar que la satisfacción que les queda es muy grande ya que ayudan a otras personas y aún más ya que los frutos que ha dado el negocio de comida ha sido que a sus dos hijos por el momento no les hace falta nada.
texts.en:
Maria Trinidad and her husband, Jesus Rodolfo, run a food business out of their home.

Their aim is to help people at the Home for Migrants, a foundation which helps migrants who have tried to cross the border but were unsuccessful, and gives them shelter and food.  Maria Trinidad and her husband provide the food every day.

The loan they are requesting will not only benefit them, but will also help their countrymen who want to strive for the American dream.  It is important to them to stock their business with quality ingredients to make the delicious foods.

It is worth noting that they are very pleased to be able to help other people, while also generating an income so they can provide for their two children and give them everything they need.

loans.use: To buy food.

loans.name: Cristiano Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CRISTIANO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Edith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agricultura, pesca, cría de ganado vacuno, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Edith es parte integrante, ella indica que hace medio año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que la fue a visitar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso, leche y charque (carne seca), cuenta que para la comercialización de estos productos su suegro la orientó para que generé ganancias de la crianza de una vaca.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta estar en el grupo de amigas.
texts.en:
The communal association "Cristiano" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center. It consists of nine members and is governed by a board of directors, of which Señora Edith is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied. Among them are agriculture, fishing, raising cattle, and selling fish.

The loan that they will take out will benefit thse little micro-entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including Señora Edith. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, joining at the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who came to visit her. Now she has a business of selling cheese, milk, and jerky (dried meat). She comments that her father-in-law counseled her to sell these products because he generated income from raising a cow.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying cattle that she will acquire from the nearby communities, and after raising them she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes being in a group of friends.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena, 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a security guard, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.
