It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nena dreams that her children will finish their college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es: Juana Gregoria de 50 años de edad,  casada con  hijos mayores de edad, independiente. Es originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsables, que tiene por actividad económica servicio de molino, ubicado en su casa de habitación, actividad que la desempeña desde hace 13 anos. La cual surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para subsistir y aportar económicamente con los gastos del hogar. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  darles mantenimiento a sus equipos de trabajo como es los molinos, como cambiar cuchillas, engrasados, pintura ,y de dicha forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Juana Gregoria agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Juana Gregoria is 50 years old, married and has grown-up, independent children. She is originally from the department of Leon, Nicaragua, which is located in the western part of the country. She is a hardworking and responsible women who has run a mill service out of her home for the past 13 years. She started the business out of necessity to have a source of income to support the household finances. She is requesting the loan to have working capital and to perform maintenance on her mills, like changing the blades and grease and paint them. In this way she can provide a better service to her customers. Juana is grateful for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scant resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to dignified work.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her work equipment.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El señor Moises habita en el Municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su compañera quien es comerciante desde hace 2 años su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda propia y tener mejores condicines de vida, entre los dos han sabido llevar los gastos del hogar pero su difultad es que no pueden reunir de una sola vez el dinero para poder terminar su casa, con este credito que se ha otorgado comprara los siguientes Materiales: Bloques, Zinc, Perlines, Cemento, Hierro, Puerta. Agradece el Apoyo que se le esta brindando y la confianza en el prestada
texts.en:
Moises lives in the Municipality of Ticuantepe together with his partner who has been a shopkeeper for 2 years. His greatest dream is to have his own home and better living conditions. Between the two of them, they have known how to handle the household expenses, but his difficulty is that they cannot, at one single time, put together the money to be able to finish their house. 

With this loan that he has requested, he will buy the following materials: blocks, metal roofing, beams, cement, iron, and doors. He is grateful for the support and confidence that he is being offered.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 63, a resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, a vendor, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria operates a meat stall. They buy pork and chicken from suppliers who deliver the meat to the respective market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will have businesses as well. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and has eight children. With her business of planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables, she successfully sent her children to school and they finished their college level education. 

Virginia wants to continue operating the business even though she is getting old. Aside from her business, Virginia has her monthly remittance from abroad but she doesn’t want to rely on it. She wants to gain access to a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds of vegetables and fruits to grow. She hopes to increase her income and plans to use it to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds of vegetables and fruits to grow.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 46, a resident of GMA, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosario maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers make as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosario dreams of giving her children a good quality education. She hopes to have a happy family with good health.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en: Tofaga is a 35-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a small plantation growing crops to earn for a living. She has two years of experience in farming. Tofaga has requested a loan to buy weed spray, fertilizers, chemical, fence material and spades. She plans to use her profits to help her business and also her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizer, chemicals, fence material and spades

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en: Sonya is 30 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, a gas oven and plastic bags. In the future, Sonya hopes to earn more income and help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, a gas oven and plastic bags.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the village of San Fernando. She is lively and innovative and has worked throughout her life to give her family a good quality of life. She opened a store based in their home and has offered a variety of basic needs for two years. She works hard in her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, detergent and other items to sell that are attractive to her customers. This way, she hopes to enhance the quality of life for her family, which is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, detergent and other items to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
Susan, de 26 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora,  además de tener decisión y ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Carlos quien es comerciante y padre de su única hija Danja de 07 años de edad.  Vive en su local alquilado junto a su querida hija y su pareja, lo que más desea es trabajar para poderle brindarle a su hija una buena educación.
El negocio que tiene Susan es la venta de calzados de segundo uso como zapatos y zapatillas de damas, caballeros y niños. Para eso cuenta con un local alquilado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, Todos su productos los trae desde la capital, con la ayuda de un amigo a quine le envía dinero mensualmente para comprar mercadería en la capital  los cuales los vende en su local. Su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y baratos.
Se inició en el negocio hace más de 08 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y ayuda en los gastos básicos de su hogar. Se siente muy  muy feliz  con la actividad que realiza, pues se siente útil y siente mucha satisfacción cuando vende toda su mercadería, le está hiendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes van a su local por sus productos cómodos y de buena calidad. En el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo numero 03  con la institución MFP, está muy contenta porque le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Se siente contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará más mercadería como calzados usados de damas y caballeros, buscando precios bajos por su compras en volumen, de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias y el stock de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Susan, who is 26 years old, is a modest and hard working woman. Also, she has courage and desire to succeed. She lives with Carlos who is a businessman and the father of her only daughter Danja, who is seven years old. She lives in a rented place with her beloved daughter and her partner. What she wants the most is to work so that she can give her daughter a good education.

Susan has a business selling second hand footwear such as shoes and slippers for women, men, and children. That's why she rented the premises in a central area of the city. All her products are brought from the capital, with the help of a friend to who she sends money every month to buy merchandise in the capital to sell in her premises. Her business is very busy, since the models are original and cheap.

She started in the business more than eight years ago, and so far, she has been doing it alone. She believe her business is quite profitable for the good profits it provides and the support to the basic household expenses. She feels very happy with this activity, because she feels useful and feels great satisfaction when selling all her merchandise. 

She is doing very well because she has many customers who go to her premises for her comfortable products and good quality. In the future, she hopes to have a larger shoe shop where she can sell with more convenience to her customers. 

This will be her loan number 3 with the MFP institution. She is very happy because they provide financial support and that will let her to increase her working capital. She knows she will have to be very responsible and above all, very punctual. She feels happy to belong to a community bank because they are very supportive.

With the amount requested of 1200 soles, she will buy merchandise such as women and men used footwear, looking for low prices for her purchases in volume. Doing so, she will increase her profits and the stock of her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as women and men used footwear.

loans.name: Samui

texts.en: Samui is 65 years old and married with 10 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, oil, a gas oven and plastic bags. In the future, Samui hopes to enlarge her business, earn more profit and help with her family matters and her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, plastic bags and a new gas oven,.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en: Lulu is 58 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells Samoan bags and traditional fans to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Lulu has requested a loan to buy pandnus leaves, gloves and knives and to pay transport fees. She plans to use her profits to develop a new business and help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pandnus leaves, gloves and knives and pay transport fees.

loans.name: Palota

texts.en: Palota is 50 years old, married and has six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Palota has requested a loan to buy weed spray, gloves, spades, chemicals and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD for two years. With her profits, Palota hopes to earn more income to help her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, gloves, spades, chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 34 years old and married with six children. She plans to start a business selling tinned fish, powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken legs, etc. She has requested a loan to buy more goods and also new goods for her business. 

Joyce will use her profits to help with family matters and her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy tinned fish, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, soft drinks, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom is 29 years old and married with two dependent children. Chhom lives happily with her family in a village of Reussey district, an area of Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she gets involved in three businesses: being a farmer, a waitress — taking food orders from clients — and a pig raiser. From each business, she can generate $2.00 a day on average. Aside from her hardships, Chhom is going to help her children in their education. She mentioned that if she can afford to pay the tuition fees of the university, she will send all her children to such higher education in the future.

For the enhancement of her pig-raising business, Chhom would like to ask for a loan of $1,000 to purchase pigs and piglets to nourish for offspring as well as for meat. She hopes for great revenue from this investment. For her future plans, she intends to enlarge her pigpen and install a large amount of pigs to raise.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and piglets to nourish for offspring as well as for meat.

loans.name: Fanuafou

texts.en: Fanuafou is 30 years old and is married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, yeast, a large cooking pot, and a gas oven. In the future, Fanuafou hopes to earn more income to help her business and her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a large cooking pot, yeast and a gas oven

loans.name: Marta Corina

texts.es:
Marta, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprando los materiales necesarios para hacer las tortillas, comprando comal de plancha, maíz por mayoreo, con esto considera trabajar un buen tiempo con lo necesario.
Ella manifiesta que su experiencia con los prestamos, le ha permitido satisfacer todas las necesidades económicas de la familia, ha logrado crecer con su familia, en su casa han hecho remodelaciones, con ayuda de su esposo, ahorros y del negocio de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan so that she can continue her business. She will buy necessary supplies for making tortillas such as a griddle and corn in bulk. With these items, she believes she will be able to work a long time.

Marta says that the experience with the loans have enabled her to meet all of the financial needs of the family. Her family has been growing and her house has undergone renovations thanks to the help from her husband, her savings, and her tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and corn in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, de 59 años, es una mujer alegre y  trabajadora. Siempre ha luchado por sobre salir en la vida. Es conviviente con Luis quien es mecánico de motos y con quien tuvo 05 hijos los cuales ya son mayores e independientes.  Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja, 02 hijas y la pareja de una de sus hijas.  Lo que más desea es seguir trabajando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
La actividad de Esther consiste en realizar diseños de ropas y costura para otras personas, por su trabajo es muy solicitada en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad, ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y luego estudio en un centro de educación ocupacional, ahora tiene su propio taller donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes.
Empezó con 01 máquina de coser hace más de 44 años y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de sus servicios dejándole buenas ganancias.
Le gusta  su negocio pues cuenta con un oficio e ingresos económicos. Aún recuerda cuando se inició, tenía muchas dudas y dificultades, pero a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo pudo superarlo, aparte de tener este negocio también se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y locales comerciales.  Espera en un futuro hacer que su negocio sea más conocido y seguir creciendo, para ello está dispuesta continuar trabajando. Por tanto éste será su préstamo  número 18 con la institución  MFP. Espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además está muy comprometida en pagar una vez más las cuotas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo de costura como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, elásticos y otros, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.  Además de comprar algunos materiales para refaccionar parte de la infraestructura de los cuartos que los pone en alquiler.
texts.en:
Esther, who is 59 years old, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She has always fought to excel in life. She is in a common-law marriage with Luis, who is a motorcycle mechanic and with whom she has 5 children, who are already grown and independent. She lives in her own house together with her spouse, 2 daughters, and the husband of one of her daughters. What she desires most is to continue working in order to improve her quality of life.

Esther’s work entails designing clothing and sewing for other people. Her work is in high demand in her neighborhood, as she is the only one who does this activity. She learned it when she was very young alongside her mother, and later she studied in an occupational education center. Now, she has her own shop, where she serves her customers with great patience. 

She began with 1 sewing machine more than 44 years ago, and up to now, she has been working alone. She considers her business to be profitable enough, because the demand for her services leaves her with good earnings.

She enjoys her business, as she can count on a job and economic income. She still remembers when she started out; she had many doubts and difficulties, but through effort and a lot of work, she was able to overcome them. Apart from having this business, she also works renting rooms and business spaces. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business more well-known and to continue growing. In order to do this, she is prepared to keep working. Therefore, this will be her 18th loan with the organization MFP. From her collaboration, she hopes to continue with her goals. In addition, she is very committed to once more paying off her quotas on time and in a responsible way. She feels very comfortable with her communal bank, since her friends from the group are very responsible and always support each other. 

With the requested loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase materials to continue with her sewing work, like fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, and others - looking for low prices on her bulk purchases - in addition to buying materials to repair part of the infrastructure of the rooms that she rents out.

loans.use: to purchase materials to continue with her sewing business, such as fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, and others.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 28, is a married woman with two dependent children. She permanently resides with her family in Reussey Keo district, an area of Phnom Penh. She helps her husband earn and manage the income by dedicating her time to rice farming. She has five years experience with this type of business and she is able to generate an averagel income of 2.00 USD per day. Phan’s husband works with his team to provide a mobile construction service around the country. By taking this loan, Phan will purchase a bamboo ladder that will be attached to a palm tree and used for collecting palm sugar. With the remaining funds, she will cover her house expenses. This loan will give Phan and her husband an opportunity to get involved in the palm sugar business. Phan is hoping to standardize her living status and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a bamboo ladder which will be attached to a palm tree for collecting palm sugar.

loans.name: Elsy De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Elsy, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque quiere comprar más inventario para la tienda, adquiriendo gaseosas, pan de caja, aderezos, condimentos, entre otros productos que le sean necesarios para continuar en la venta.
Ella considera que con la utilidad de los créditos ha logrado comprar productos para cierto tiempo, que le permita mantener a los clientes satisfechos, manifiesta que el negocio está creciendo.
texts.en:
Elsy decided to request a new loan because she wants to buy more inventory for her store. She will acquire sodas, bread by the box, seasonings, condiments, and other products that she needs to continue her sales.

Elsy says that the loans have been used to buy products when needed. This has allowed her to keep her customers satisfied and maintain a growing business.

loans.use: to buy sodas, bread, seasonings, and condiments.

loans.name: Edwin Andrés

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven campesino de 21 años de edad dedicado a las labores de la agricultura desde su infancia, actividad que aprendió de su padre. En la actualidad tiene cultivos de  papa capira y tomate de árbol, productos que vende el día domingo en la plaza de mercado del municipio  de Sonsón, Antioquia, Colombia.
Edwin es un joven con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y está seguro que la única forma de lograrlo es estudiar, por lo cual decidió ingresar al colegio los fines de semana y dedicar el tiempo restante a su negocio. Su mayor sueño es poder ser un gran profesional para administrar con la mayor eficiencia sus cultivos y generar mayores ingresos que permitan ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Con la esperanza de mejorar su producción Edwin se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes agrícolas, que le permitirán generar una mejor producción y una mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young farmer who is 21 years of age. He has engaged in farming since childhood and learned this trade from his father. Edwin currently grows potato and tomato crops. His products are sold on Sundays at the central market in the town of Sonsón, Antioquia, Colombia.

Edwin is a young man who has great plans for success. He says that the only way for him to accomplish his goal is to study, so he decided to attend school on the weekends and spend the rest of his time with his business. His greatest wish is to become a successful professional so that he can manage his crops with greater efficiency, thus resulting in more income that will allow him to provide his family a better quality of life.

With plans of improving production, Edwin is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost and fertilizer. These supplies will allow him to facilitate better production and greater profitability.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Melvin Geovanny

texts.es:
Melvin, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en Siguatepeque, Comayagua junto a su esposa e hijos.
El tiene 10 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos de  tallado y diseños en madera, fabrica muebles con tallados y presta el servicio de tallar madera a otras personas que le solicitan. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por 4,500 lempiras para comprar una maquina para cepillar madera, con el propósito de prestar mejor servicio al cliente y obtener mas ingresos. Con esta maquina preparara su madera ya no va pagar por cepillado. Su plan es hacer crecer su negocio y ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Melvin is 38 years old and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Siguatepeque, Comayagua.

Melvin has 10 years of experience making and designing items made from wood, such as carved furniture. He provides his woodworking services to people who request them. Melvin is currently requesting a loan of 4,500 HNL in order to buy a planing machine. His goal is to provide better service to his customers and to generate more income. This machine will enable him to prepare the wood without having to pay someone else.

His plans are to grow his business and to help his family even more.

loans.use: to buy a planing machine.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, continuara con el cultivo de granos básicos pero necesita capital de trabajo  es por ello que tomo la decisión de solicitar otro préstamo para pagar mano de obra para desgranar maíz, 
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior  le dio resultados positivos ya que aumentaron sus ganancias y le sirvió para la  compra de alimentación de sus hijos  y también invirtió en educación, y vestuario. Esta mejor económicamente y está muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
José continues to cultivate basic grains, but he is in need of operating capital. For this reason, he decided to request another loan so that he can pay for labor needed to remove the corn kernels off the cob.

José says that his previous loan generated positive results. He was able to increase his earnings, which enabled him to buy food and clothing for his children and invest in their education. His family is in better financial shape and in good health.

loans.use: to pay for labor for processing corn kernels.

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru: Хурмат мотивированная и целеустремленная женщина. Она является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж не в состоянии содержать семью и поэтому Хурмат является основной кормилицей в семье.  Более 4 года она занимается купле продажей индустриальных продуктов. Она торгует на местном рынке, но в последнее время у нее мало клиентов и она не может развевать бизнес. Хурмат уже несколько месяцев была в поиске нового бизнеса и к ее счастью она прочла в рекламе о курсе «Добейся успеха», который организуется Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Хурмат обучилась в этом курсе  и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  хлеба. Она будет продавать хлеб возле своего дома, так как спрос на хлеб всегда большой. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки хлеба, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hurmat is a motivated and diligent woman who tries to improve her living conditions and stimulate the economic status of her family.  She is 31 years old and is married with two children.  Her husband is not in a position to support the family and for that reason, Hurmat is the main breadwinner of the family.  For more than four years, she has been involved in the purchase and sale of industrial products.  She works in the local market, but lately she has fewer clients and she wants to increase her business.  

Hurmat has been looking for a new business for a few months and thankfully she read an advertisement about the "Get Ahead" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen.  She enrolled in the course and received a certificate and now she wants to start a business buying and selling bread.  She will sell bread near her home, as the demand for bread is always high.  With the income from this business, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie foods.  She is asking for a loan of 7,000 somoni to buy bread to start her business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy bread to start her new business

loans.name: Gataiala

texts.en: Gataiala is a 59-year-old married woman with 11 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, yams and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Gataiala has requested a loan to buy more chemicals, weed spray, gloves and spades. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Gataiala hopes to improve her business and use her business's profit for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, gloves, spades, and weed killer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng is the head of a family comprising five members. He lives with his wife and children in a small village in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. To support his living costs, Heng has provided motorcycle repair services to people coming from the surrounding areas. Through his skills, friendliness and good communication with his clients, Heng is able to generate a suitable income of 7.00 USD each day. However, Heng’s spare parts have been running low, which has disturbed his business activities so far. Because of this, Heng would like to apply for a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase motorcycle spare parts to increase his current inventory so that he can stabilize his business and thereby maintain his revenue. In the future, Heng dreams of having a large repair shop recognized by many people in his community.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts to increase his current inventory.

loans.name: Ahchew

texts.en: Ahchew is 29 years old and married with 4 children. She plans to start a business selling lavalava (cloth worn as a loincloth or a skirt). She has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, lavalava fabric and designs. Ahchew will use her profits to help with family matters and for her kid's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric material, needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Dorthy

texts.en: Dorthy is 35 years old and married with 8 children. She plans to start a business selling goods like canned fish, diapers, powder, chicken legs, soft drinks, twisties, etc. She has requested a loan to buy new goods for her shop. Dorthy will use her profits to help her children's education and family matters. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy canned fish, diapers, soft drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth is very busy trading her palm sugar in her community situated in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She generates an appropriate income of 5.00 USD each day to support her family and provide infant formula to her baby. Vuth’s husband is the main person supporting her business. Every day, he dedicates his time to climbing palm trees for palm juice, which is made into palm sugar. Also, Vuth buys sugar from villagers for additional stores before she supplies it to the market where she can make a profit. Vuth has been doing this type of business for almost 7 years. She is now 25. 

At the moment, Vuth is applying for a loan through Kiva’s partner, HKL, in order to purchase a motorcycle for household use. Her family currently suffers from a lack of personal transportation. This vehicle will enable her to develop her living standards. In the future, Vuth wishes to have a house where she  lives apart from her mother’s family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena dreams of having her own frozen food factory. Lorena has a stall in a public market where she sells hot dogs and some frozen foods to her customers. She loves her business: that’s why she has been doing it for almost 13 years. Lorena is 41, married and has four children.
She started the business when she got married. She began this business to improve her family's future, especially her children's education. With regards to her dream, Lorena believes that by borrowing a loan of 35,000 PHP will help her dream become reality. Lorena plans to use the loan to purchase a large volume of hot dogs to sell in order to minimize her shipping expenses. In the future, Lorena will own a factory outlet of frozen foods.

loans.use: to purchase hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 57 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, oil, a gas oven, plastic bags and yeast. In the future, Loreta hopes to earn more profit and help with her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, a gas oven, plastic bags, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has been a meat vendor since 1990. She is 47 years of age and married with six children. All her six children settled for marriage and have their own families already. Her spouse works as a butcher within their local community.

Elvira works hard to get ahead in life. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare fresh cuts of meat to sell. She would like to increase the kilograms she sells due to the many customers who go to her butcher shop. For this reason, she needs more capital in order to supply all her customers. In regard to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP25,000 which will allow her to buy more hogs. She knows that this loan amount would really have a great impact on the smooth flow of her business.

loans.use: to buy more hogs to be sold in her butcher shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 51-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She has a small business, gardening and cutting grass. She has 3 years with this business. Kalala needs a loan to buy herself a new grass cutter, gloves, a wheelbarrow and other supplies. She will use her profits to support her family and kids. Kalala joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new grass cutter, gloves, wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Evelinda requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Evelinda would like to save enough to provide a financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Accrington

texts.en:
Accrington is a resident of the Nkubu area in Central Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for ten years, producing mainly fruits like mangoes and bananas for the local market. He is aged forty six years and married with three children aged between 20 and 7 years.

Accrington has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy piglets. He says the venture will help him generate enough income to educate his children. He notes he will also save part of the income for a venture into dairy farming.

He says the main challenge remains lack of capital for running farming as a business.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Taliilagi

texts.en: Taliilagi is a 35-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a business selling taros and bananas in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Taliilagi has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, etc. She plans to use her profits to provide good financial support for her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, bush knives, a wheel barrow, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin is 36 years old and is single. To make a living, Erwin owns and operates a food stall. He has been in this business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Now he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Erwin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 57, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Together with her children, she manages the household while operating a business. She works hard to continuously provide for her family's everyday expenses. 

Gloria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Gloria hopes to have a continuous good health to help her children and grand children and dreams to have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 27 years old and lives in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is single and has three children between the ages of 4 and 13. They are in school and live at home.

For the past seven years, Comfort has been selling soft drinks, cold water, juice, peanuts, oranges, and eggs in the local market. She likes her business because the items she sells are fast profit-making goods. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, cold water, juice, peanuts, oranges, and eggs for her business. She plans to expand her business and help her children financially in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cold water, juice, peanuts, oranges, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

NWTF is relisting Arlene's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of an eleven year old son from Bohol, Philippines. Mauricia has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more twenty years now. This is the source of their income.

Mauricia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With these items, her husband will be able to improve his daily catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Mauricia hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
Ma. Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers. 

NWTF is relisting Ma. Editha's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Kithake

texts.en:
Kitheka is 52 years old and married with three children aged 15, 22, and 26. He has been selling car tires for the last five years, making a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

He is borrowing a loan of 70,000 KES, with which he intends to purchase more tires to sell. He plans to expand his business with his anticipated profits.

This is his third loan; he successfully paid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 52, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ronaldo, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She keeps herself busy attending to her family and doing business to help her husband pay the family's daily expenses.

Lydia operates a pillow-making business. She cuts scrap materials from textiles, foams and fibers, puts them in a plain pillow case and covers it with a better looking pillow case of various cartoon designs. She makes different kinds and sizes of pillows. Prices range from 35-80 PHP per pillow. Her regular customers are her neighborhood and local community. She also has clients in the market who regularly order pillows from her. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 16, 000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy foam, cotton, fabric, plastic, and other materials needed to make pillows. She expects a boost to her income as she expands her business. Her earnings will be a big help in paying the educational expenses of her children. 

Lydia hopes her business will continue to grow and dreams of giving all her children a good and quality education. She wants a good life and health for her family. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship groupis composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build socialcapital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more foam, cotton, fabric, plastic, and other materials needed to make pillows.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old, married and has five children. 

She used her previous loan to buy jugs, mugs, cups, and plates. Her business did well, and she managed to repay her loan. She is very hard-working, and has been in business for three years. She also earns an income by selling paraffin. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money. 

She hopes to be a successful business lady. She has requested a loan of 20,857.50 KES to increase her stock of jugs, mugs, cups, and plates.

loans.use: To increase her stock of  jugs, mugs, cups, and plates to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora  y con muchos deseos de superación, así como amable y cordial.  Es conviviente con Elmer quien trabaja de estibador.  Vive en compañía de su padre, madre, su pareja y sus 03 hijos de 19, 15 y 05 años de edad quienes son su motivación, habitando cómodamente su propia casa que construyo sobre el terreno que le cedió su primo. Las actividad que realiza Gloria  es la venta de abarrotes en general en el interior de su propia casa, para lo cual abrió una pequeña bodega donde tiene a la venta los principales productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,  fideos, avena, entre otros 
Iniciándose hace más de 03 años con la ayuda de su pareja, de quien fue la idea y con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros más un pequeño préstamo, logró comprar los primero productos en pocas  cantidades, logrando crecer de a poco con un rotación constante de sus mercaderías.
Considera rentable su negocio por las ganancias que le deja y por ser su bodega la más surtida de la zona. 
Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar  en casa y cuidar de sus hijos menores a los que quiere mucho, también por los ingresos económicos que obtiene para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar ya que muchas veces no les alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos. 
Tiene planes de continuar, ampliando la diversidad de sus productos para así tener mayor preferencia de sus clientes y abrir un nuevo negocio que es la venta de comida por las noches. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03  con la institución MFP, por tanto desea de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a todos sus miembros y no tiene problemas con ninguno de ellos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles,  una  parte como  700 nuevos soles los  invertirá en compra de  abarrotes en general como aceite, arroz, azúcar, entre otros, a precio por mayor  para surtir su bodega y  con el saldo comprara utensilios como ollas, platos, cucharas, para abrir su nuevo negocio y  contar con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old. She is a hardworking woman who really wants to get ahead. She is also kind and cordial. She lives with Elmer, who works as a stevedore. She lives with her father, mother and spouse and their three children, aged 19, 15 and 5. They are her motivation and they live comfortably in their own home that she built on the land her cousin transferred to her. Gloria's activity is selling general groceries from her own house. She opened a small store there where she sells the main basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, pasta, oatmeal and more. 
 
Starting more than 3 years ago with her spouse's help, whose idea it was, and with her own capital from savings plus a small loan, she was able to buy the first products in small quantities. She was able to grow little by little with a constant rotation of her merchandise.  

She considers her business to be profitable because of the earnings it brings her and because it is the best stocked store in the area. She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and care for her younger children, whom she loves very much. She also likes her business because of the income it brings in to support her spouse with the household expenses, because many times they didn't have enough to cover their expenses. 
 
She plans to continue, expanding the diversity of her products so she will be more preferred by her customers. She also wants to open a new business, which is selling meals in the evenings. This will be loan number 3 with the MFP institution, and so she would like your help to continue with her goals. She also says that she likes her communal bank because she knows all of the members and has no problem with any of them.

With the amount of 1000 nuevos soles that she has asked for, a portion of about 700 nuevos soles will be invested in general groceries such as oil, rice, sugar and more, at wholesale prices to stock her store. The rest will be used to buy utensils such as pots, plates, and spoons to open her new business and have more earnings.

loans.use: to buy general groceries like oil, sugar, rice, sugar and more at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Evelith

texts.es:
Evelith, de 27 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser amable y cordial. Es separada del padre de sus 02  hijos.  Vive en compañía de su papá, su mamá, sus 03 hermanos, su abuelo, su tío, y sus hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad a los que  quiere mucho, viviendo en la casa de sus padres.
La actividad que realiza Evelith es la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas de diversas marcas y sabores.   Para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora y un pequeño local en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes de una manera amable y cordial.
Se inició hace más de 03  años con un capital propio y actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes atienden cuando ella está fuera de casa. 
Paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la preparación de mermeladas, oficio  que aprendió en un proyecto de la municipalidad de su localidad,  por el momento no lo está realizando. Esta actividad lo realiza sola 
Le gusta su actividad ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder brindarle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Escogió éste negocio porque vio poca competencia por la zona. Las ganancias que obtiene le da tranquilidad emocional y financiera. Por otro lado viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de mejorar e implementar su negocio y comprarse otra refrigeradora. Por tanto éste será  el préstamo número 03  con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal ya que conoce a sus miembros y los considera personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen  y con el saldo  lo invertirá en la reparación de actual refrigeradora que está fallando.
texts.en:
Friendly and polite Evelith (27 years old) is hard-working and has a lot of desire to move ahead in life.  She is separated from the father of her two children.  She lives at her parents' house with her mum, dad, three siblings, grandfather, uncle and her two children (eight and five years old) whom she loves very much.

Evelith sells various brands and flavours of chilled soda.  For this she has a fridge and a small area in her house where she tends to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner.

She started this work over three years ago with her own capital, and she now has the support of her parents who serve customers when Evelith is out.

As well as selling sodas, Evelith also makes jams, a skill she learned as part of a project run by the local authorities.  For the moment she is not doing this.  She does this work alone.

Evelith likes her work as it keeps her busy and gives her an income which she can use to offer a better quality of life to her family.  She took on this business because she saw that there was little competition in the area.  The money she is making gives Evelith financial and emotional peace of mind.  Plus, seeing the positive results, she now has plans to improve the business and buy another fridge.  So, this will be her third loan with MFP and she feels happy to count on the loans so as to make the business progress.  She also says that she feels comfortable with this communal bank because she knows other members and believes that they are friendly and responsible.  

Evelith will use the 600 Nuevo Soles loan that she has applied for to buy sodas of various brands and with various labels. She will look for low prices to buy in bulk and any money leftover will be used to repair the fridge which is currently not working very well.

loans.use: to buy sodas of various brands and with various labels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain citrus fruit plants.

loans.name: Jose Genaro

texts.es:
José, 68 años de edad, originario de Rivas, pero tiene 30 años de vivir en Managua, casado, con conocimiento académico de quinto año de secundaria,  padre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de  la venta de carne. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  vendiendo carne hace 6 años, lo cual lo empezó con capital  propio, dinero que obtuvo de su anterior trabajo, ya que el trabajaba en una empresa que se llama el Carnic, el cual obtuvo bastante experiencia y decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de carne, negocio que le genera muchas ganancias, el cuenta  con  otros  ingresos que obtiene de su pensión de jubilación,  este ha sido su único negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de  su esposa , sus  expectativas es  distribuir sus productos en misceláneas  y  supermercados para que le genere mejores ingresos para mantener su negocio estable.
José solicita el financiamiento para comprar más carne. El  estima   que este préstamo  le ayudara  a crecer en inventario  asi  poder ofrecerle, otro tipo de carne variado para satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela, sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio, efectuando compra de otros activos que aun no tiene en existencia,  su meta próxima es invertir en la compra y venta de carne.
texts.en:
Sixty-eight year old Jose is originally from Rivas but he has now been living in Managua for 30 years.  He completed up to the end of fifth year of secondary school and is married with five children.  The are all now independent adults.  Jose is a businessman and works selling meat.  He started this six years ago with his own capital that he earned in his previous job, with a company called "Carnic".  It was there that he gained experience and decided to start up his own meat selling business.  This business generates lots of profits and he also receives a pension.  This is the only business he has had and counts on support from his wife.  He hopes to sell his products to general stores and supermarkets so as to generate a higher income to keep the business stable.

Jose is applying for this loan to buy more meat.  He thinks the loan will help him to increase stock and be able to offer other types of meat to satisfy the needs of his customers.  His plans for the future are to expand the business by buying other meats that he does not already offer.   His next goal is to invest in the buying and selling of meat.

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Rubiela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rubiela de 54 años de edad, es una mujer a la que la vida le ha enseñado el significado de lo que es el trabajo y la responsabilidad. Después de separarse de su esposo, se vio en la necesidad de buscar una fuente de empleo para sostener y educar a su hijo, por lo cual recurrió a la cría de cerdos, a la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía, actividades que son la fuente de ingresos para su casa. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una cerda y mercancía -ropa- con el fin de aumentar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos.
 
Su mayor sueño es poder comprar una vivienda, debido que el alquiler  es uno de los gastos que más dolores de cabeza le genera.  Aunque el dinero no ha sido su mejor amigo, lucha día a día para ofrecerle a su familia una vida digna y sin carencias económicas, pues asegura que los más importante es la unidad y el amor.
texts.en:
Rubiela is 54 years old. She is a woman whom life has taught the significance of work and responsibility. After separating from her husband, she saw the need to seek a source of employment to support and raise her son. She turned to raising pigs, selling products via catalog, and selling merchandise. These activities are the source of the income for her home. Today she is asking for a loan to buy a pig and clothing merchandise so she can increase her sales and generate more income. 
 
Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a house, since renting is one of the expenses that gives her the biggest headache. Although money hasn't been her best friend, she fights day to day to offer her family a dignified life that doesn't lack financially. What matters to her most is unity and love.

loans.use: to buy a pig and some clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 58 years old and married with five children.

Eugenia is in the agricultural business. She farms vegetables in the Philippines. 

Eugenia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Eugenia has been farming vegetables for six years now. She has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Eveline Laure

texts.fr: Eveline est une femme de 43 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont les âges sont 12 ans et 7 ans, tous allant à l'école. Elle possède et gère une petite boutique où elle vend des bijouts et parûres dans un coin de la ville depuis 9 ans. dynamique et chaleureuse, elle a une clientèle grandissante dont elle ne parvient plus satisfaire. Ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant des bijoux et autres accessoires. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son activité (nouvelle boutique) et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition).
texts.en:
Eveline is a 43-year-old single woman and a mother of two children, aged 12 and 7 years old, who both go to school. 

She owns and has been managing a small shop for nine years, where she sells jewelry and finery. Dynamic and warm, Eveline has a growing customer base which she can no no longer satisfy. This loan will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise by buying some jewelry and other accessories. 

The profits will allow her to expand her business ([by opening] a new shop) and to support the needs of her family (education and nutrition).

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 47-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to Simon, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Lydia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff member. Lydia will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into a zero-grazing farming business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.
